description:
So yummy!! 
We got general tso and chicken with string beans. Both were delicious. I asked for my string beans to be spicy which I'm glad I'm did. The Tso's was one of the best I've had.
We also had the shu mai and dumplings (def get them!).
author: Alissa C.

description: The best place for Chinese food in SF! Came here on a cold day- the chicken and corn soup was warm and really hit the spot. Ordered my favorite- wet flat noddles. The sauce/gravy is so flavorful and pairs perfectly with the bok choy. The fried rice is amazing. So flavorful and not too salty. The XLB was warm and was great with vinegar and soy sauce. My favorite is the wings- crunchy and drenched in a sweet and salty sauce. Ask for some hot sauce if you like things a little spicier. Their portion sizes are big! Great place for a cheap and convenient meal.
author: Ngoc My H.

description: Jasmine is the spot! This might be my favorite Chinese food in San Francisco. Portions are huge. I love the won ton soup, house fried rice, and walnut prawns. Chicken plates have big pieces of chicken, not small questionable meat lol. The ladies who work here are all super nice, they know me from how often I visit. Definitely one of the original spots that hasn't been discovered by too many out of towners. I'm an SF native and highly recommend!
author: Manny R.

description:
Absolute worst experience ordering food. After keeping me waiting for over an hour (original wait time of 20 minutes) I called to try and figure out why things were taking long. Shortly after they confirmed a driver picked up the food but then they proceeded to cancel my order within a minute of doing so.
I attempted to call and resolve the situation at which point they hung up on me. Did not receive so much as an explanation.
author: Joe Y.

description:
Dim sum is a collection of small bites that can either be consumed as a snack or created into a full course meal. 

Looking at the menu, I knew I wanted just a small taste of what they had to offer. I noticed the dim sum combo meal, which includes pork siu mai, shrimp dumplings, and pork buns. 

Sounds good enough. So I placed my order and had a seat in the dining area. 

Food took about 10-15 minutes to arrive because it was made fresh to order; came out piping hot. The pork siu mai was tender, flavorful, and the outer wrapper was moist, not hard or dry like the ones that sit out for too long under a heat lamp. The shrimp dumplings were juicy and popping. The pork buns were really good. Soft and doughy with sweet bbq pork filled inside. All this for $9.50 too. Great deal

The restaurant looks really run down from the outside, but the inside is clean enough, just really old looking. No frills, but service was really friendly and accommodating. 

$10 minimum when using credit or debit, otherwise, ca$h only. 

Don't forget to grab your complimentary fortune cookie at the counter!
author: Ann S.

description:
i just cannot agree with all the other customers reviews.  As soon as I walked in I wasn't greeted at all and knew i didnt want to dine here. No sort of customer service skills here and I knew I wanted to leave this place. I didn't want to be rude and gave them benefit of doubt. 

To make it worse the dim was is severely overpriced and not to its standard. Being that I love dim sum and tried almost every dim sum place this place is horrible. I guess this is for Americanized customers to enjoy.

To make matters worse there is hair on the food. When brought to their attention they asked if i like another plate. At that point, i said no thanks. I was just done and over with this place after a few dishes and the rude waitress or owners of this restaurant. 

Little do they know I speak their language and understood every bit of it. 

Feels good to know they talk the talk thinking I don't understand, or speak any of it.
author: Meishi M.

description:
TLDR - Not a bad option for delivery if you're looking for an easy fix for Chinese food/dim sum but quality is sacrificed for convenience

I wasn't expecting much from the food here when I ordered delivery. Mainly picked this spot on GrubHub for the low $15 delivery minimum and $0 delivery fee. I was pleased the food actually travelled well with delivery (no soggy, cold food), but it took maybe 90 minutes from when I ordered for my food to be delivered.

The menu looked very Americanized, which held true when I got my delivery. As long as you're not expecting real Chinese food, you probably won't be disappointed.

* DIM SUM COMBINATION PLATE ($9.50) - 3.5/5
[3 each of shrimp dumpling, pork bun & siu mai]
Pretty standard as far as dim sum goes. Shrimp dumpling and siu mai were a little greasier than average but otherwise normal. The BBQ pork in the pork buns were overly artificially red in color and sweet, but the buns were soft and fluffy and balanced out the extra sweetness.

* FRIED CHICKEN WINGS ($7.95) - 4.5/5
Dry fried, nicely salted. I was impressed that they managed to maintain most of their crispiness with delivery, but they could have been a little less greasy.
author: Jessie L.

description: Always solid Chinese food, great price and good service. It's clean, flavorful and a great spot for dimsum all day.
author: Caitlin S.

description:
We came here because other place we planned to go to, but im so glad it was! 
We ordered pot stickers which had a thick wrapper and very flavorful filling. 
Ginger chicken wss tender, and just enough ginger. Tasted like it was marinated for a long time! 
Green beans were heaven, though not too spicy. 
Hong kong noodles were amazing!
Overall, definetly recommend it!
author: jessica a.

description: Delicious food, very good service, good prices, and the staff make you feel welcome and comfortable Whenever we arrive the owners are very attentive and more than customer service feels that they treat you like family, that's why I love getting to this place even though sometimes my children want to go every week and it may seem boring but the food is good that's why I go back once and again
author: Zu P.

description:
It's a good thing I had a $7 delivery coupon. The food here is lacking in freshness. My food came cold and soggy. I'm disappointed but what do you expect with Chinese food deliveries... hit or miss. 

Ordered the dim sum combination plate and onion pancake. 

Onion pancake - 
Didn't even get to take a picture of the pancake bc I threw it out after the first bite. It was dry, cardboard like with no real taste except for bitter oil. Gross.. so gross. DONT GET THIS SAVE YOUR $6.

Dim sum combination plate -
Bbq pork buns were soggy and overly sweet. 
Shrimp dumplings - good. Small but good. 
Siu mai - the meat itself had a lot of flavor but I wish the siu mai was fresh. I have a feeling they keep their siu mai under a heated lamp for hours. My siu mai was rubber like. Disappointing 


First and last time ordering food here. I don't think dining in will improve food quality either.
author: AJ C.

description:
Gone way downhill. Used to come here regularly a decade ago, used to be awesome. Haven't been back for a while, looks like the same staff, price and menu about the same, but wow has it changed for the worse. 

Rice was extremely clumpy and seemed like the "microwave day-old rice" trick. And the sauce of one of my (former) go-to favorites General Tsao chicken was terrible. So disappointed. 

Ah well, other good places around here now, guess JTH had a good run.
author: T J.

description:
NEVER GO HERE! READ BELOW TO FIND OUT WHY

I Ordered chicken dishes from the lunch menu and immediately noticed extremely low quality meat hidden in sauce. Upon ordering and taking two bites of the chicken dishes in total, I was disgusted at the taste of what seemed to be raw chicken. The restaurant refused to take the food back and insisted that I pay for all the dishes. The Chineese restaurant continued to argue why I should pay for the food and even followed me to the next door restaurant I went to after. So they could call the cops to make us pay for food I did not eat. It's unfortunate this business rips customers off for food they did not eat
author: Howard R.

description:
From the start we were greater with friendly faces. The menu options were good. I really like how you can chose your spicy level, I'm a big baby and can't handle any spice! 

I had the General Tzao Chicken and it was amazing. My boyfriend had the chicken fried rice which was amazing as well. We were too full for
desert, but I was dying to try the green tea ice cream. 

I would come back again!
author: Star A.

description:
I never thought it would be hard to find good Chinese food in San Franciso 
I think it's since Hong Kong's change in 1997 the Chinese changed here to the deep fried version of cooking. 
We ordered Szechwan Beef. Not nice strips of quality beef but deep fried to death beef with no flavor. General Tso's which I know is an American invention, but get it right or don't do it. Just completely fried to death with no flavor. Just sugar yuck!
Very disappointed. 
Even the Hot and Sour soup was terrible. 
Oh well. I'll keep looking.
author: Ken B.

description: I started eating here after I read the piece about Bill Clinton always getting takeout from here when he's in SF. Potstickers are super yummy and I appreciate the vinegar and chili sauce!
author: Kay S.

description: I order lunch here all the time! This place is so good. The other negative reviews are hilarious... "they squished I sesame seed balls" are you kidding me? it's not presentation when you're ordering it for delivery. Plus, it still taste the same why do you care? anyways, on to why this place is a such a good restaurant. I order for delivery all the time I come in to pick it up sometimes as well anything is always sweet to staff is really nice. Sesame seed chicken fried rice wonton noodles are my favorite. If you're ever in the area should definitely try this place out.
author: Sasha M.

description: Meh. Ordered from Grubhub because I was craving dim sum and this was the best rated place that was open in my area. Pork buns were a solid meh. (Kind of on the sour side actually.) Sesame balls were ginormous, but had very little bean paste filling, so were mostly dough. THe pork shu mai was passable. Great dim sum always leaves me with a warm pleasant feeling. This mostly just made me feel dirty. Pass.
author: Megan B.

description: I'm not a big fan of Chinese restaurant not in neighborhoods with a lot of Chinese people, because the food is not the same. I came here with a co-worker who wanted Chinese food. I had better Chinese food in Chinatown/Richmond/Sunset so this place was alright. The lunch specials were priced at reasonable price though.
author: Jennifer T.

description:
The best combination Won Ton soup anywhere.
Perfect broth.Generous portions of shrimp beef chicken pork and vegetables.Im full after eating the toppings and take most of won tons home for another meal.
I ordered it delivery once but it wasnt as good because in the restaurant its served piping hot.
author: Ken K.

description: I've been going here since my childhood days. I grew up eating jasmine tea. I absolutely love it. I've gone to other Chinese restaurants but this is by far the best restaurant I've ever gone to my entire life.. it will not be replaced for sure! Lol. I grew up on eating the dumplings with won ton soup.. perfect for rainy days. Lol. Love this place.. I'd rate it a 10 star if I could!
author: Dasha F.

description: Best Chinese food in SF, always delicious, delivery is always on point, excellent staff!
author: Karen G.

description: Jasmine Tea House is my go-to place! My friends and I came here on Saturday afternoon and the owners were so kind. They greeted us and were super kind. My favorite was the fried rice and honey walnut shrimp!! Such good comfort food :)
author: Nareena V.

description: Solid spot! The food is excellent, always served hot and fresh. I especially recommend the fried rice paired with general tso chicken. The staff is friendly and attentive. For quick, affordable, basic chinese food, this is one of your best best in mission/castro.
author: Lisa G.

description: Jasmine tea house is my new go-to for Chinese food. The  service is really nice and the food is the best. Definitely make sure to check them out whenever you are in SF! Order either the beef chow fun or honey walnut shrimp.
author: Jacky Z.

description: Jasmine Tea House has some of the best Chinese food around. The Chow Mein and Walnut Shrimp were bomb and the service was great. Definitely will be coming back.
author: Hali Z.

description:
Come here and get the shrimp dumplings. I've been ordering from here for the past 3 years purely because of these dumplings. They are insanely good -- best shrimp dumpling in the city. 

Get the dumps.
author: Ri R.

description: This place is solid. I've only gotten takeout and delivery from here but it's always fast, fresh, and delicious. The staff are friendly as well.
author: Dan P.

description: I always order "I don't wanna cook" combo with sweet & sour chicken. My 3-year-old loves it!
author: Cindy D.

description: Jasmine Tea House has amazing food! I had the Walnut Shrimp, fried rice, chow mein, chow fung, and assorted dimsum. Everything was so delicious!! 10/10.
author: Michelle G.

description:
I think maybe they changed ownership again....?
The potstickers are still amazing, same menu....but the eggplant dish and Kung Pao were not as good as I remember.
author: El B.

description:
You know those restaurants that leave a togo menu on your door? This is one of them. And with a migraine I decided to give them a shot. How bad can delivery dim sum be?

The menu has a dim sum selection, typical appetizers, chef's specials, and the regular staples. What I did enjoy was the section of "Don't feel like cooking" which gives you soup, rice, egg rolls, and the meal. However with a $20 delivery minimum, you need to get two or load up on appetizers.

I decided to go with the dim sum sampler, an order of pot stickers (I love dumplings, I can't help it) and the special fried rice.

The dim sum sampler was nothing to write home about - the bbq pork buns were decent enough, the shiu mai was ok, the har gao was flavorless. The pot stickers were the best, those I would order again.

The fried rice is filling, but very greasy. I know, pretty weak review, but it was delivery and only a small section of the menu.
author: Michael C.

description:
Ordered for delivery on a Friday night, delivery was fast and service over the phone was nice . My order was complete , no mistake. Combo plate appetizer didn't taste fresh feels like it was precook / heater  and order were smaller than I was expecting ( from average Chinese restaurants ) . everything bit oily but good taste .  Good place if you're not a demanding eater .
Overall good.
author: Morena M.

description: I have been ordering for delivery from Jasmine Tea House for about 15 years. Consistent quality, excellent meals, dependable service, etc.
author: Stephanie B.

description: Read the great reviews and decided to ordered for delivery through Grubhub.   Ordered was confirmed at 6:35 pm  and I got message that restaurant was in the process of preparing order and it would be delivered between 7:35 and 7:45 pm.   At 8:00 pm I called and after waiting on hold for ten minutes they confirmed my address and said the order was in route.  8:30 I called back and after waiting on hold again and providing my address was told the ordered had never been processed. Poor customer service from Jamine Tea House and Grub Hub.  I called Grub Hub and they said they called the manager and was told the restaurant was very busy.      Never got a chance to taste the food.
author: Kevin C.

description:
Must get the Shrimp Dumplings! They are Tasty.

We knew going in that this place served Americanized Chinese food based on the menu outside, but we certainly did not expert the the shrimp dumpling (har gow) to be this high quality! All the tables around us also ordered this.

Other than the dumplings, we also ordered the lunch specials, which were Americanized Chinese food as expected, and was very tasty. The portions were huge, and the fish was deeply marinated, which I thought was much more professionally made than I had expected. The service was great as well--the waitress would often come and talk to the customers or ask how they were doing etc. Overall the wait staff seems to really care about making a good impression on customers.
author: Henry L.

description:
Delicious! Delivers to the area! Can't believe it's so tasty AND ALSO CHEAP!

Definitely way more economical than using one of those delivery services to do the delivery.

The singapore-style noodles were particularly good.
author: Al W.

description:
This place is NOT good for dim sum. It's an Americanized Chinese restaurant, that has a large menu that includes a small set of dim sum items. The BBQ pork was served with a Panda Express style sweet and spicy red sauce. The pea sprouts were yellowing and impossible to chew. 

Some items were pretty good, and the food is cheap, but for that price I'd rather go to Panda Express.
author: Jess C.

description: This is probably the best Chinese I have ever had in or around the Mission area. The fried rice was exquisite. Also the honey walnut shrimp was creamy and crunchy.
author: Leo F.

description: This is probably my favorite Chinese food in San Francisco. I ordered the fried wings as an appetizer and general tso's chicken dinner. The portions were big and the food was fantastic. The prices are on the lower side which is always a plus. The staff is very nice and I always am happy to eat here.
author: Ryan J.

description: Delivery took long like 1.5hrs . Eat 24 seems to charge $1 more than the menu (compared the menu that came with the food to eat 24 prices). The eggplant shrimp dim sum is delicious, other stuff was just alright. I did not like the mango prawns and scallops at all.  Will order direct from them next time and see if there is a difference in delivery time and price. And will try some other stuff. But will always order the eggplant shrimp dim sum!
author: Karen K.

description: Foods great, but the delivery guy was a little rude. I ordered on the eat24 app and when i put in my credit card it shows the tip section where $0.00 appear. I assume it means no tip because it doesn't give u an option not to tip. I get my food, the delivery guy asks, you have a tip for me? Which is weird cause i thought if you put $0.00 then it would appear "no tip." I told the guy I don't have cash cause I paid by card, and he rudely says, "then next time don't put cash in the tip option" and left. It may be the app with that technical issue but he didn't need to be rude about it.
author: Desiree F.

description: This place is a little pricey for a Chinese whole in the wall type of restaurant. I can say that it's just "ok" taste wise and some of their fisher were underwhelming. The BBq pork in particular wasn't good.. Thin slices of meat that is reminiscent of small bacon slices, no the good kind.
author: Jan R.

description: Ordered with Eat24, they said order time would be 40min and it got here in 25! The Dim Sum combo plate was cheap and perfect for 2!
author: Mandy F.

description:
I absolutely never would have suspected that this was going to be a five-star review. Truth be told, my stomach's been upset the last two days (I'll spare you the gory details) and I just came home, put on sweatpants, and got on Foodler to order soup, since I wasn't feeling up to going out at all.

$15 minimum (low) and no delivery fee? Score. Ordered the wonton soup for tonight, the chow fun noodles for my lunch tomorrow. Just barely covered the minimum for delivery. Under $20 for two meals, big meals actually, including the delivery, taxes, fees, etc. Simply can't beat that. As long as the food is good.

The wonton soup was outstanding. Tons of noodles, tons of shrimp, they really didn't skimp. Impressive, really. Joseph, the delivery driver, was very sweet, and even though his map program screwed him up and sent him to the wrong place (happened to me too with my own home address, don't know what's up with Google maps), he was still in good spirits and pleasant when he arrived.

This is my new go-to Chinese food delivery place for when I'm lazy. Which is, clearly, often.
author: Sean B.

description:
Delivery arrived only 5 minutes late, which was quite good, everything considered.

Recommend:
1. combination wonton soup
2. pork siu mai - super tasty, one of the best in town
3. lunch plates (available even on weekends)

Avoid:
1. happy buddha - the meatless chicken is weird and tasteless
2. Shanghai chicken - there's virtually no veggie in this dish, and the chicken is diced into super small pieces.  Plus, I had requested super spicy but it was not spicy AT ALL.  Not even a hint of peppers.

Plus:
The guy on the phone speaks very decent English.

Overall:
Stick to the pork stuff - siu mai, wontons, etc.  They seem to do that well.
author: Kristen S.

description: I absolutely love this place and go here very often. The general chicken is killer- juicy and flavorful!!! I like to get the veg mooshu and it's always a winner- I die for their hot and sour soup which is filled with veggies and has a yummy peppery spiciness to it. Will recommend to everyone all the time.
author: Jane L.

description: The dim sum is super. The delivery is super. The portions aren't small. I think a lot of budget Chinese places are gross and scary. This one is not. The ingredients are fresh.
author: Francesca S.

description:
The deliver takes a long time.
The food did not come fresh.
The food was very soggy.

Please choose another place.
author: Shadai U.

description:
If you are in a pinch for Chinese food this place is ok. Ingredients didn't seem fresh. Dim sum had a funny taste to it. 

Price is reasonable. I ordered take out so didn't experience their restaurant service. Not sure I will be ordering from them again. There are too many better Chinese places to pick and chose from.
author: Tonia D.

description: I love this place. The staff is super friendly, and the the food is delicious. the portions are also very reasonable.
author: Emily G.

description:
Tasty Chinese food!
Good delivery, good portions, good food.
Very good dim sum selection, I get some every time.
author: Sandor M.

description:
Jasmine Tea House is yet another of many Americanized-Chinese restaurant in the Bay Area. I stopped here for tea and Wonton Soup when I was feeling under the weather and spending the afternoon in the area.

While I rarely order wonton soup and don't have too much of a basis of comparison to other versions in the city, I enjoyed JTH's Wonton Soup, which is filled with generous portions of meat and is well flavored.
author: Asha S.

description: v consitsent.  imo best chinese delivery in mission.
author: Will E.

description: I would recommend eating in instead of ordering to go. For me the food taste better when dinning in. Of the 20 times i have eaten here i only had 2 complains about my food. Once was about it being to salty and the other was because my soup was cold(lunch). My top 3 favorite thing to get from here is the garlic chicken, Mongolian beef and combination wong tong soup.
author: Joshua B.

description:
Ordered the peking duck, general tsao chicken and chow fun.

All of these items are what you'd expect from an "americanized" chinese restaurant. 
Not totally authentic chinese cuisine, as they have a mix of both american and real chinese dishes, but definitely hits the spot if you want something quick and convenient. A bit on the pricey end for chinese food, but there are definitely worse options in the mission.
author: Andrew E.

description:
Ordered the meatless kung pao. It didn't come with rice, so they should mention that. Otherwise it was delicious.

They also had tasty veggie dumplings and onion pancakes. Highly recommend those dishes.
author: Arjun M.

description:
I've ordered Soo many times from these guys.  Always good. 
But tonight they they F'd up and said NO! Don't count on delivery from these guys. 
I called at 945pm, business hours everywhere online say 10pm, I should still be able to put a order in! Didn't happen. 
Jasmine tea house if you don't want to take orders at certain times you need to update your business hours to reflect that!
author: O. S.

description: Combination wonton soup, Sesame chicken, pork fried rice with chicken noodle...that's all I got to say. Your winning.
author: Brandon L.

description: I love this place I always come here! Service is great! The guy owner is a really cool guy! He already knows what we want before we order! Best part good food super cheap close by! 5 stars! Keep it up!
author: Erika E.

description:
For the price, portions and the excellent customer service, this place deserves 5 stars. I went to this restaurant with my boyfriend last week. I have been sick and had bad service from restaurants all week so this was a nice change of pace to the usual service I get at Chinese restaurants.

The server was a very sweet, polite and professional hostess. She was everything you want at a restaurant; she constantly refilled our waters, answered questions without acting bothered (I had asked her what tea to order and she recommended the Iron Goddess of Mercy as the one that customers like--very good tea. The food was fresh and delicious--perfectly cooked.

We ordered the general tsao's chicken, pork buns, and corn soup with a side of chinese broccoli. The broccoli was perfectly cooked with just the right amount of crunch and seasoning. The chicken was excellent. I also remember going here with my sister a few years ago and having a similar great experience, so it's nice to add consistency to the list. I see some of the reviews of certain entrees aren't so good, but every restaurant has its specialties so if you order something you didn't like, try the general tsao's and the pork buns with broccoli!
author: Megan N.

description: Food is always good here and owner/manager is very friendly. Peking duck is a must! Also their wonton soup is awesome. Food isn't overly greasy or salty. Definitely an asset to the Mission after NuLite Kitchen closed down.
author: Roger E.

description:
we had one of our vendors in our store, they wanted to buy us lunch.  We use to use Jasmine once a week for take out.  Apparently the new owners don't care about customer service. We placed an order to feed 10 people.
They delivered enough food for an army.  The bill was $140.00! We called the new owners to question this and their reply was "too bad".  
Well TOO BAD we won't be ordering again, and hopefully this review brings some sense to the new owners who don't care about customer service, let's just gouge the customer!  The food has taken a dive along with the service, and the old owners of Jasmine are sorely missed.  
These are people you can not trust!!!
author: Jim S.

description: Great lunch menu and great price. The general Tsao is my favorite. They offer dim sum menu throughout the day but you probably want to go to real dim sum restaurant.
author: James L.

description: Awesome Chinese food, and friendly staff. Dim Sum Sampler is my favorite.
author: Tommy A.

description: The tea had no flavor, but it was free. The waitress couldn't understand that I wanted the house spicy chow mien with only shrimp and instead brought me shrimp chow mien with a little bit of hot sauce in it. It wasn't spicy and it had no flavor. The only reason why I am not giving it 1 star is because the shrimp dumplings were amazing.
author: Ivania M.

description:
Good turnaround time on online carry out orders in the middle of the day.  Specific dish impressions:

steamed pork bun - quite good, worth ordering again
hung to yeo wonton soup - terrible, the wonton soup in Henry's on Church St. is so much better
roast duck lunch special - rather good, but a small portion

Overall, Jasmine seems most useful for round the clock dim sum with easy online ordering.
author: Natalya E.

description: This place is spot on for delivery.  The portions are not huge, but sufficient and the food is great.
author: Stephanie R.

description:
I've been coming here for years and I'm so glad Jasmine Tea House re-opened! 

I like Chinese food, but since I cannot eat MSG, I feel limited by the choices sometimes. Not Jasmine Tea House, I can always trust the food will be cooked fresh, fast and delivered for free on orders over $10.00.

I decided to order out of my usual and got the beef noodle soup. The broth was extra "flavorful" and felt that I should have just stick to the regular dishes ot the wonton soup. Everything else I've had here was good. 

My roommate and friend ordered wontons and the combo with sweet and sour chicken, rice and the whole meal. They were really pretty good and a lot of food for the price. 

I'll keep coming back to Jasmine Tea House. Consistantly good food.
author: Rebekah T.

description: I was sick and craved dim sum. Don't ask me why I just did lol And this was the only place that had the option, even if it was only a few options, that delivered to me. It took a little over an hour, but it was worth it.
author: Maya F.

description:
Ordered delivery last night so this review is fresh:

4/5 for Delivery - They delivered my food on time.  Food was still pretty hot, my walnut prawns were still crunchy.  The delivery guy apologized and said he forgot the rice but as I unpacked my food, I did find a small box of rice.

3/5 Walnut Prawns - The prawns were heavily battered.  Authentic walnut prawns have a very light batter so that's what I expected.  Because of the thick batter, the prawns were a little greasier than I usually like them.  I suspect they use a thick batter to keep the prawns more crispy.  Other than that, they tasted good, just not what I was craving for.

4/5 Szechuan Beef - Great flavor, mildly spicy, all you can expect from a spicy beef dish. 

2/5 Mapo Tofu - Spicy level and consistency of the sauce was good but it lacked any real flavor.

3/5 BBQ Pork Bun - My kids usually gobble up BBQ pork buns without hesitation but they did not like the BBQ pork filling at all.  The steamed bread of the bun was edible but nothing special.  

I would order from them again for delivery but would stick to hard-to-mess-up dishes like stir fry dishes.
author: Ivy Z.

description: Awful service and lackluster food. I will never order from this place again. After waiting darn near 2 hours for my order I get it and didn't realize my bag is dripping sweet and sour sauce that I've now tracked through my place onto my bamboo floors. I retrieve all the containers and have to clean them all because they are drenched in sauce. I call to complain and the staff is not apologetic nor do they offer any recourse. When I finally dig into my food to eat I bite down onto some foreign object in my pork fried rice. Not quite sure what it is. Thankfully it didn't crack my tooth. They promised to call me back in 30 minutes to sort it out and it's been 47 minutes and no call back. Save yourself the trouble and order elsewhere.
author: Willette C.

description:
Good food, but soooo oily. Some of the servers know English better than others. All try to be nice though.

Unfortunately, they didn't get my order right -- and if I had seafood allergies, I would have suffered from those wontons. But honestly they didn't really seem to understand me that well anyway, sigh. The Shanghai buns were great, and the wonton soup came out much differently than I expected (with a lot of veggies and meat on top) but was still really good!

Just remember to wash your face after you eat here.
author: Kimberly Y.

description: Very disappointed in the seafood chow fun and shrimp fried rice that I ordered this evening.  Both dishes were lacking in seafood and flavor, and the chow fun was overly greasy.  I also don't like how their hot and sour soup lacks strips of pork.  It would also benefit from additional white pepper.
author: Monica O.

description:
The Jasmine Tea House is great little Chinese food spot in the Mission. The best in this neck of the woods.

The portions are very generous, the food is really good, the service is good and the price reasonable. The only complain I have is that the food is very salty but that hasn't stopped me from coming back.
author: Liz H.

description:
Jasmine Tea House is my Chinese food spot.... when your looking for great take out- these guys are the ONE! the food keeps great and as always is delicious. 
the only issue that I have came across is the fact that I can never order won ton soup from another restaurant ever again! These guys are my favorite spot in the city...
author: Corey G.

description:
Review for delivery only....

PRO:
* fast delivery, and hot too!
* paid attention to special requests in order
* affordable

CON
* shrimp dumplings were... odd. Fishy.  Despite all the great reviews I've had better and won't order again. same with shrimp balls.
* $20 minimum for delivery is high
author: Lis W.

description:
Ok. So I've frequented this place, plenty, over the past year (or maybe even 2?), and for shame, I only now write a review (UPDATE: Inaccurate ~ forgot I posted a review, before; see below..). My hope is that this message is read and received, with a mind for progress with this establishment..

They've gone from an absolutely spectacular little restaurant to order from to the subpar stature of most every other Chinese food place in the Mission area ~ one often blames popularity for this shift (and this place has definitely grown in popularity).. I would just hope that they haven't grown comfortable not trying as hard. As I continue this review, accept my apologies if I seem to wax nostalgic.

A year+ ago, the food was *amazing*. I'd think I were being hyperbolic, but I distinctly recall coming away with the same impression about their food, each time, before. My measuring of Chinese food establishments tends to rest on a small set of 'staples' that I use to compare different establishments: the chow mein, the general tso's chicken, and their pot stickers. Price Matters, and is considered heavily (not specifically for being *cheap*, which is important, but if Free is the best spice on steroids, spendy Chinese better be Very freakin flavorful..).

I write this review, and it pains me(kindanotreally), because where a year ago this place was absolute Top marks ~ not Only for price, which was just fantastically cheap (assuming because they were very new), but for Flavor & Quality. The pot stickers, here, at a time, were long and aways the best in the Mission. Period. AND amongst the cheapest. Now I feel a bit ripped off. They've gone up ~$2 per order, since.. their quality has gone down significantly (biting into hard chunks of gristle is Gross ~ this has happened at least a few times more recently), and the flavor's just not there, anymore, beyond those respects/concerns. 

When the pot stickers go, the rest follow ~ the other dishes have gone up in price, down in quality. The chow mein (once also really good) is just oilier and less flavorful. I still like the General Tso's chicken. Also, their combo Won Ton soup was a steal and a blessing lol, and I still love to order that to this day. The dim sum is also pretty awesome, though, again, food quality concerns (gristly pork siu mai.. ew)..

Appreciate that this review is less a damning of the establishment and more the noted frustrations of a once-immensely pleased patron. It took a long enough time to find a place in the area that delivered really good Chinese food, and this was IT, once. I write this with the realization that this establishment has since come to risk attaining a similar mediocrity (at inflated price points)  that the rest of the Mission seems dead set upon resting on. And it's sad, really. Just not something I want to see..


===== Original Review:

I really have to say that I am impressed with the food that comes out of this place. I have ordered food here a few times, and they've been consistently delicious. For one, their potstickers are better than most everyone else's in town, period. Most anywhere I go, I order the potstickers (a. because iLoves them and b. its a good 'quality test' for a Chinese cuisine establishment), and consistently, Jasmine Tea House outclasses the rest for flavor and texture and just overall preparedness. 

This applies for the dim sum, as well - the pork siu mai and shanghai baby bun were, too, some of the best I've had in the city. In general, I am very happy with how well the food is prepared, here. It was worth getting on here to write a review for them. Will frequent farrrr more often.
author: Cory H.

description: What a delight this place is! Everything is delicious. General Tsao's Chicken, Mandarin Lamb, BBQ Pork Bun... Also a delicious assortment of teas. We haven't ordered anything at this restaurant that we haven't loved. In addition, the staff is incredibly friendly, the restaurant is clean, and the service is fast, even when they are busy.
author: T. Celeste L.

description: I've ordered delivery here many times. The food is not going to surprise you or blow you away. Nevertheless, I appreciate that this place is consistent and delivery is fast. The dim sum items are pretty good.
author: Henry T.

description: This is my default chinese resto if I'm craving soup and dim sum. Not only is the price great for its location, they don't hold back on giving you content. E.g I ordered a cup of seafood soup (less than 5 bucks). In that soup they give me whole prawn, scallops and squid. Love this place!!
author: Helen C.

description: I've order food here many times in the past and never had any issues, until today. Picked up some lunch and halfway through my meal, I found a rusty nail in my food, and brought it back right away! They said it wasn't from their equipment, but it may have been in their shipment of rice. All I got was my money back and a lousy apology. Took some photos and got a business card signed by the owner. Let's hope I do not get sick!
author: Taylor S.

description:
Fantastic lunch special.   Delicious and inexpensive.   

Plus, it's Bill Clinton's favorite chinese restaurant in San Francisco.  
Fo Real:  http://www.sfgate.com/entertainment/article/Ring-those-dinner-bells-3314975.php
author: Super T.

description:
Wednesday night, 9pm, delivery to the Outer Mission for quick dinner. My GF and I ordered Jasmine Shrimp, Chicken Black Bean Sauce (they made this special for us), and we received a chicken fried rice for free. Total bill $25 after delivery tip.

Comments:

- Chicken used in the Chicken with Black Bean Sauce was such poor quality. It was all the small oddly shaped pieces of chicken that come from all the places on the bird that you don't want to think about. Chewy, lots of little segments that have the cartilage or ligaments still partially on it. Not a single proper sliced chunk of quality chichen meat in the entire dish. Very unpleasant to eat and so very disappointing. We order a lot of chinese takeout and this had to be the worst we've had for $9.99. Grade: Fail.

- Fried rice. Rice was very dry and a but hard. They didn't use enough water to soften it before frying and not enough oil to give it proper body. Grade C.

- Shrimp dish was acceptable. Grade B+.

Conclusion:

My god there is such better Chinese takeout in this town and neighborhood than this place. The people raving about this place on Yelp need to get a reality check. I've learned my lesson, get personal referrals and don't rely on Yelp in the future.
author: Tom K.

description:
Really good, reasonably priced Chinese food. 
I love food, but have always found Chinese food to be very forgettable until I found Eliza's on California in PAC heights in high school. Eliza's is more expensive and is a much fancier restaurant, with higher quality food, but jasmine tea house is equally as good. 
I love the mixed meat wonton soup. 
My girlfriend loves the vegetarian fake meat dishes here, and has ordered the mock general Taos chicken for many years. 
Remember this is not a fancy restraint, but a place for good Chinese, so consider delivery or pickup.
author: isaac t.

description:
The lunch prices are reasonable and the food is decent.  

The owner is rude.  I come her frequently mainly because it is convenient to come for lunch.  I would not give this place my business after work hours or during the weekend.  However, if you are in this area and want something quick, reasonably priced and that tastes good, you will not be dissappointed.  Though I would not look for superior customer service.
author: GoldBlooded J.

description:
The next time someone has a problem with your online ordering platform and calls to cancel their order don't go psycho on them and repeat call them a dozen times demanding an apology and accusing them of being racist.  Jesus dude... wtf? You seriously need to go on a vacation or something.

This place has great food... I have no idea what the owner is on however.
author: Ben W.

description:
I realize all of my reviews are either 1 or 5 stars, probably because I only review places I either love or hate. Let's change that shall we? 

This place is great! Not a fancy meal, but delicious and well cooked. The service is great, the price is right (...well, considering that we are in SF and the price is NEVER right, its pretty reasonable). The tea is also delicious, they have quite a selection - good thing for a tea house - and we always leave full and satisfied. For the record, my dude loves this place and if it were his review it would have 5 stars.
author: Alisha E.

description: Service was slow, they forgot to bring our drinks and they ran out of the Saki canister and shot cups so they served cold Saki in a wine glass.  The kind of takes away from the experience of drinking it.  The dish (variety on one plate) was delectable.  Food was good enough for me to give it another go.  I appreciate good food.
author: MyShawn C.

description:
Ditto to the other reviews.  Tasty, hot, affordable Chinese food.  I suspect I'll be back for a great many lunch specials

Ideal to sit down and grab lunch with someone
author: Christian S.

description: Order well before you are hungry because my delivery took over an hour and a half. My food arrived cold and the soup had leaked all over the bag.
author: Manny F.

description:
-Vegetarian Review-

Not in the mood to walk down the hill in the rain I decided to order from the Jasmine Tea House. The Yelp reviews were all over the place and the negative ones seemed to focus on the meat dishes so my hunger won over and I ordered online (always a wonderful feature). 

Delivery was quick (ten minutes early by the time they gave) and easy. I payed fully online so no money to exchange. The driver was professional. 

I ordered several small things and some fried rice. All fairly cheap.

The food was a resounding "meh." Not the best I've had but not the worst. The fried rice does not have a lot of veggies in it (a negative since there is no protein in it). The veggy chicken was a decent texture, but neither of the dishes I got were particularly well flavored. So eating the fake chicken (which is rare) was not exciting. The tofu dishes were fairly typical. The potato curry puff was the strangest of them. The pastry part reminded me more of baklava than anything else. The potato filling was pretty small and not overly flavorful.

In the end it served its purpose of filling my lazy stomach. Nothing special. Wouldn't go consistently but wouldn't say that I'd never go back either.

Bumped up to 2 stars for good service.
author: Connor D.

description:
I the Duchess of Jasmine Tea House have not reviewed this place O...M...G!

So here is the real scoop on Jasmine Tea House. This is a hidden Gem on Mission street on the front skirts of Bernal Heights. The Locals (San Francisco PD & I ) have conquered this place (their entire menu / and it's extensive). We walk right in there and they know exactly what were coming for. 

For me it goes like this: 

MON: Combination Wonton Soup
TUES: Combination Wonton Soup
"
"
"
(You can assume what the rest of the days look like)

Although this is the best Combination Wonton Soup in the Universe, it's probably because they put in a bucket of salt. However with that Bucket of Salt, they also add shrimp, pork wontons, beef, chicken and the list goes on. Don't get me wrong I've tried other plates, but this one..... I heart! I will give an honorable mention to their egg plant dish, the pork bun and dim sum. 

I really can't find anything wrong with this place (unless they come out on the news for cooking dogs and cats, I'm sold).  Their prices are amazing, the waiters are nice and helpful. You feel super safe because there's always a cop in there. Oh yes! Did I mention I'm the Duchess- a title seldom earned anywhere in SF-the city of yelp. 

p.s I use to go over to Erik's but that was before I discovered Jasmine Teahouse. I understand that not everyone might agree with my love of Jasmine's however if you live in the area and are looking for some good yummy chinese food, I strongly encourage this place.
author: Lannette G.

description: Jasmine Tea House is both a neighborhood gem and worth a visit even if you don't live in the neighborhood. Everything is good -- really good; the service is fast and friendly; and the prices cannot be beat. If I knew my next meal would be my last before leading this planet, I would have a very hard time choosing between Jasmine's House Special Noodle Soup and their General Tsao's Chicken. If you're local, delivery is SUPER FAST, as well.
author: David K.

description: I wasn't sure about this place, but it's right by our house and I'm a sucker for good chinese, so we gave it a whirl. I was pleasantly surprised with this place and we've already gone back again for lunch. We tried a handful of the dim sum items (crab rangoon, dim sum sampler) and the Kung Pao and General Tsao's chicken. The pork buns and General Tsao's chickens are so good!. This place is also surprisingly cheap for SF - their lunch portions are really big and are $7 - $8. The atmosphere is a little weird - it's always kind of empty and the inside is dated, but worth it for the food and price. This will be a delivery staple.
author: E F.

description: Really good Chinese food. Good flavor. Love the wonton soup, sesame chicken is hecka good !!
author: Diana L.

description:
Why this place only has 3.5 stars is a mystery to me.  My husband and I stumbled upon this gem while we were trolling the Mission for some place new.   The decor is subtle, but then it does not have to be over the top when the food speaks for it's self.   

We started out with the Sizzling Rice Soup.  The broth was clear and filled with seafood and vegetables.  The rice was toasted just right and added a just the right touch of flavor.  We also ordered the Asparagus in Black bean, the  Tea Smoked Duck and the Pork in Garlic Sauce. 

 The asparagus was thick and tender.  The sauce just slightly over salty, but went well with the sweet asparagus.  The Tea Smoked Duck was perfect.  Not very fatty, good amount of meat, crispy skin and a wonderful duck sauce.  

The Pork in Garlic Sauce was the Star, it was the perfect blend of garlic and spice.   This is my "go to" dish, the one I gauge a restaurant by.   I have got to tell you, I was never so happy with a plate of garlic pork than I was with this one.  

A true Mission Treasure.
author: Stephanie G.

description: It's a shame that you can't rate less than 1 star. The staff is unpleasantly rude and the service is terrible, that is if you get your food! Stay away!
author: Greg D.

description:
This is my favorite (and only) choice for Chinese delivery in SF. I've been getting delivery here for the last 6+ years, and the dishes are consistent in quality, freshness, taste, and portions. 

I love ordering the combination wonton soup and happy buddha, which are both stacked to the brim with various ingredients. No skimping here! The combination wonton soup comes with bbq pork, shrimp and pork wontons, shrimp, bok choy, carrots in a delicious, savory, and very flavorful broth. The happy buddha has large chunks of meatless chicken, shitake mushrooms, carrots, broccoli, bamboo and is quite a filling dish.

I've also had the bbq pork buns and kung pao chicken here (via delivery), which were both fresh. The kung pao chicken thankfully did not come with fried doughy pieces of chicken, but stir-fried pieces of chicken and lots of fresh veggies in a kung pao sauce.

I guess what I most appreciate about Jasmine Tea House is its use of fresh (and not canned) veggies, which so many Chinese restaurants seem use. The flavors are great and not Panda Express-like. Delivery wait can be a drag, but food is usually pretty hot when it gets here - and it's worth the wait!
author: Carolyn F.

description:
OK, you have to picture Nancy Kwan wrapped in a white terry-cloth towel in her boudoir in "Flower Drum Song"...
"I'm strictly a female female
And my future I hope will be...
In the home of a brave and free male
Who'll enjoy being a guy having a girl... like... me.
When men say I'm sweet as candy
As around in a dance we whirl,
It goes to my head like brandy,
I enjoy being a girl!"

Jasmine Tea House just doesn't sound like it belongs in the Outer Mission among the tacquerias and pupuserias. It sounds more like a brothel in Hong Kong where long-limbed Suzie Wongs would wait three to a table for lonely American businessmen..."Hey Joe, I be good wife, I be good wife...you see, you see".

But there are no bar girls in tight silk dresses here. Just a small, tight-fitting place with passable Chinese food. The good deals, of course, are the $6.50 lunch specials where you get a heaping cup of hot and sour soup followed by whatever you order off the menu. I went for the Roast Duck (see my photo), which was somewhere between decent and chewy. The service is quick though, and they keep the place fairly spotless despite the unsavory visitors that may stop by for handouts.

FOOD - 3 stars...passable, budget-conscious Chinese in the Outer Mission
AMBIANCE - 3 stars...an old-fashioned place like where Ralphie and his family went for Christmas dinner in "A Christmas Story"
SERVICE - 4 stars...dutifully fast
TOTAL - 3 stars...if you really prefer a potsticker over a pupusa, you probably took the wrong bus...but you could do worse
author: Ed U.

description:
Very cheap Americanized Chinese food that tastes pretty good! I highly recommend coming for the weekday lunch specials (located on the back of the menu) because the portions are huge and will fill your stomach for only $10 (includes tip and tax). I have tried the chow mein dishes and several rice dishes and the only negative thing I can think of is that the food can be a little too salty occasionally. The sweet and sour soup (which comes with your dish) is a favorite among my coworkers. 

The service is good and the waiters are friendly and quick at responding to needs. 

I have not checked out the restroom yet, but I can say that the tables and utensils are clean. The ambiance and lighting are good.
author: Alan L.

description:
So I love coming here for the lunch special menu. It is affordable and has delicious options. I've tried the sizzling rice soup which was so delicious. The orange chicken is really good too. The broccoli beef was tasty and the kung pao chicken was great as well. I recommend this place for anyoneo looking for an affordable place to eat delicious Chinese food. The portion size is large which is great for sharing.  

Bottom line: tasty and affordable Chinese food!
author: Priscilla A.

description: Great service, consistently good quality, and very generous (leftovers, anyone?) portions for the price.
author: Greg V.

description: This is my local go to for dim sum and Chinese food. The prices are reasonable, the food is good, and the service is great and fast. All their noodle dishes are good especially the house noodle soup.They also have a good selection of hot teas. I will be back soon :)
author: Jordan B.

description:
Typical neighborhood Chinese joint. Staff was very pleasant. 

Hot and sour soup was not my thing and a little bit too pungent (think sweaty boot) for me. 
Pork sumai was pretty delicious. Highlight of the meal. Spicy basil chicken was underwhelming and the sauce was hard to describe. Thick and slimy may be the best way to describe it. Chicken was the weird preformed stuff you get in low-end Asian restaurants. 

Soup, tea, dim sum and large entree for under 9 dollars. WHAT!

If you are looking for a top notch meal, head elsewhere. For value at lunch time, this place simply can not be beat.
author: Anthony G.

description:
Been coming here for years and have to say they are one of my favorite Chinese restaurants in the city. Their wonton soup is so good and is filled with a lot of meat and vegetables. 
General chicken and Korean chicken wings are delicious also. I have not tried anything I did not like. I either order for delivery or take out. They have lunch menu for a decent price.
author: Des A.

description: The combination wonton soup was tasty but delivery was half an hour late and we had to ladle out 3 tablespoons of fat out of the soup.
author: Jm C.

description: I love this place the food is fresh and even hot when delivered they pack it up nice. The food I got was fried chicken, pork buns, prawn fried rice, prawn chow mein, combination Hong Kong noddle and wonton soup the food is definitely worth the price it is great. I recommend this place for everyone.
author: Erika B.

description:
Very mediocre delivery tonite.

Got the dry sauteed spicy shrimp.  Maybe they delivered the wrong thing?  It was terrible --  deep fried breaded bland horrorshow.  I couldn't finish it.  Nothing sauteed about it.  

The won ton soup was OK; they did everything well except for the won tons, which have bits of gristle in them.  The broth is good, the veggies fresh, and the sauteed chicken, beef, and shrimp on top are all good.  There are two musts for excellent won ton soup:  the won tons, and the soup. 

The spicy green beans were the best of the lot.

C'mon JTH, why you done me wrong?  I'll try again though.
author: Goolie G.

description:
Jasmine Tea House is a great fit for you when you need some shrimp dumpings (har gow) delivered to your house in the rain in about 50 minutes. In the Mission! This is no small discovery, and for this purpose Jasmine is ideal.

Pros:
Shrimp dumplings - delicious and generous. 4 will fill you up.
Veggie steamed buns - surprisingly good - great outer texture with distinguishable ingredients (cabbage, mushrooms, etc.)
Lunch special prices - $6ish for entree + rice + hot & sour soup, and still available on the weekends.

No-Gos:
Shrimp with lobster sauce - very gelatinous (almost like soup). Decent flavor but strangely goopy.
Chive dumplings - Not recommended; mushy insides with undesirable flavor.
Shanghai baby buns - Not recommended, very mushy insides with indistinguishable filling. And where's the soup? Not worth the $4.
author: Megan G.

description: This place used to be ok but it's gotten worse. All of the plates taste the same, seems like they use the same sauce for everything. The owner also seems to be in a bad mood, no where near as social or welcoming as he used to be. I would not recommend this place, at least not until they change their recipes and style.
author: Marlo M.

description: This is what San Francisco is all about -- delicious Chinese-American and dim sum for a reasonable price! Love it! Love it! Love it! Keep up the good work, guys!
author: Evie O.

description:
We needed something hot and yummy for dinner and Jasmine Tea House did just the trick. Delivery was as expected, we ordered through Eat24 so I can't say anything about the customer service but it was an overall good experience. 

I was so happy to find Walnut Prawns (which I became addicted to after working in a Chinese restaurant in college) and Jasmine Tea House did not disappoint! Nice toasty walnuts, large juicy prawn with a light sauce that didn't soak into the breading but caramelized it nicely. TRY THIS!

Hubs ordered some General Tao's and that was good too, pretty standard, the broccoli was good and fresh with nice big pieces and the order size was a good portion. 

If we are back in the Bernal Heights area we will most definitely be ordering from here again, I would absolutely recommend it.
author: Littany W.

description:
The good:

Lunch specials were a great deal! Dishes are at the most $6.50 and comes with ride and hot and sour soup. The portions were also really big for a lunch special. 

The bf liked his spicy eggplant. 

The bad:
My garlic fish had bones in it. It wasn't a whole fish but slices of fish battered and fried and then cooked on the pan with veggies and sauce. It shouldn't have bones in it. I was super annoyed at that.

Table cloths were dirty with food stains. 

Homeless man walked right into the restaurant and collected cans from the restaurant's garbage. The owner let him in and maybe he's doing a good deed, but at least meet him outside so he won't bring his stench inside.  

I'll probably return to give it a second chance and to try the Happy Buddha, but for now, 2.5 stars.

_______________
I just checked out their health inspection score.. 44!!  Forget about that second chance..
author: Vivian H.

description:
I am so glad Jasmine Tea House is open again. I was really panicking for a moment there!

There are not many decent Chinese food options in my immediate area and when I saw that it was closed I was so desperate that I nearly walked into Nulite. Fortunately, I will never have to do that. 

Whenever I'm craving Dim Sum and not feeling up for a trip across town, Jasmine Tea House's Dim Sum Combination Plate is my go-to. The Happy Buddha is also a great choice because of the variety of vegetables in the dish. And I always order two entrees to get the free fried rice. I really can't ask for better quality and quantity when it comes to take-out Chinese.
author: Iris L.

description: Oh how I love Jasmine Tea House. You can have anything on the menu made with their fake meat (which is fabulous), but I love the ginger fish, the chow mein and any of their fake meat dishes (so basically everything on the menu)
author: Kayla B.

description: My grandmother used to have Jasmine Tea House cater her parties when I was younger because there food was sooo delicious!! So walking around Mission street, my family was hungry and I saw the place and told them how fabulous the food was. OMG!!! The menu is the same BUT the food is AWFUL!!! I already got a bad vibe when the lady gave me a full pot of their "house special" jasmine tea. The pot was sooo dirty and then my niece opened the lid and it was even more gross! Everything tasted bland or very salty and oily! The straw in my other nieces water had a black mark on it, she was disguisted. After 10 minutes of eating, I started getting dizzy spells. Also my nieces stomachs started to hurt. I'm so disappointed. I wanted to complain but I didn't want to cause a scene. Soo not worth the money. The only thing nice was the workers and decor, but we came to eat authentic chinese food which sadly it isn't.
author: Jasmina O.

description:
We been customers for 20 years now and I'm sorry to say they've lost their touch. Maybe there's a new chef?
This time we had spare ribs and eggplant with portabella mushrooms with tofu- we asked for xtra eggplant and no tofu but they added tofu anyway (very tough and difficult to chew). The sauce was VERY greasy and not flavorful. We also ordered Chinese BBQ spareribs -UGH! so tough we couldn't eat them plus no flavor. The soup was okay (sweet/sour) but we were extremely disappointed. We won't be eating there again - it was a real waste of money.
author: jaime r.

description: This is a typical American Style Chinese Restaurant.  The portion of dishes is pretty good size.  Almost every dishes here are deep fried.  So healthy is no but tasting is definitely yes if you enjoy deep fried food.  If you want authentic Chinese food, this is definitely not your place.  I only come here once in a while.  Definitely not your usual place to go to unless you wanna be unhealthy.
author: Sarah S.

description: Outstanding General Tsao's Chicken! Reasonable prices and great service, too. I will be returning. Highly recommend.
author: Ira S.

description:
The food is fine - it isn't great as I remember it, but it's decent.
The big big problem is dine-in service.  We ate dinner there on a Monday evening when there were maybe 2 or 3 other tables of customers.  The service was horrible.  Food was brought out very slowly to our table.  Some of our dishes ordered included moo-shoo and chicken-lettuce wrap.  They brought out the lettuce cups with the moo-shoo ingredient, but nothing else - no moo-shoo pancake and no chicken insert for the lettuce wrap.
I realize that they are focused on take-out orders, but it isn't fair to sacrifice the orders of table-side customers.
I see no reason to ever return, because there are enough other decent Chinese restaurants in San Francisco! I've been eating at Chinese restaurants in SF since I was a child in the '70s, so I know that there's definitely nothing special at Jasmine Tea House.
author: Michael S.

description: Came here on 1/19/15. Not a very good experience here. The hours state that the restaurant opens at 11am but we didn't get seated until about 1130am. The food was average but very salty. We ordered the garlic fish and cashew chicken lunch specials. Towards the end of my meal, I noticed a mushroom shaped object that turned out to be a hard piece of plastic! I brought it up to my waiter but all they said was a simple "sorry." The waiter mentioned it to the owner and the owner didn't say a single word. I do not recommend anyone eating here especially because of the many other options for chinese food here in SF.
author: Ray Daniel V.

description: its ok for greasy Chinese...the last few times i have ordered, it was wrong and i just got delivered the wrong order again. the girl with broken english said she was the manager was also the person who took my order...My boss loves this place, but i think it is time to look for another greasy Chinese place that gets the orders right!!!
author: Franziska G.

description: I always loved eating here Until a RAT ran out of the kitchen and the employees did nothing about it...
author: Fiona S.

description:
This place is ~4 blocks from my house. Therefore, it is one of my go-to spots for a mid-week bad food decision. I'm so glad it reopened, even with new ownership. 

So this isn't the best Chinese food in the world. But it's perfectly adequate, and does its job well. 

Pros: 
- Tasty food. Standard take-out favorites. The scallion pancake is actually really nice. 
- In addition to that, they actually have a small dim sum menu. Making a weekend bad food decision easy. Hey, I don't have to schlep to Hong Kong Lounge to get my dumpling fix. 
- The place is dirt cheap, especially at lunch. 
- Their set menus which come with "extras" (free fried rice? something like that?) are a good value. 

Cons: 
- Well, it's just not that great. If I'm ordering delivery, I'll order from Crazy Pepper out in the Excelsior. 
- I mean, the food is so terrible for you it's not even funny. But erm... I just need to run more, right?
author: Tom P.

description:
Their sesame balls are huge and delicious! I wish that was all I had to say. However, this place rocks: they deliver free if you order more than $10 worth of food and it was reaaaaally delicious food. Definitely worth my money. I feel really bad for not tipping the driver...But I only had $13 on me which was exact change...he didn't seem to notice, though. But next time I will definitely remember tip!
Their chicken in black bean sauce was terrific, but it needs to come with rice.
author: Alexandra R.

description:
IMHO, one of the best Chinese places for clean establishment, good cuts of meat, fresh produce, ample choices, delivery and customer service. While I am a bigger fan of the previous ownership, I still frequent this place dine in and delivery. 

Fan of:
-Walnut prawns
-Shanghai Fillet
-Crab Puffs
-Eggplant with shrimp
-Chow Fun
-Wonton Soup
-Sweet and Sour Faux chicken
-Happy Buddha
author: Solitaire M.

description: Very good veggie dumplings!! Loved the Veggie Mu Shu as well.
author: R P.

description: I think this is some really good chinese food and they deliver. They will even make anything off menu if you mention it to them. The service is always very friendly and they have a huge selection of vegetarian dishes. This is the best place I've had won ton soup...its fully loaded with everything including won tons. YUM..Great lunch specials too! I think I may go today ;-)
author: C. M.

description: What can I say! This place never seems to fail me! NEVER! Its a great little restaurant with a nice cozy feel. Great place to bring a date for some good food! The servers and manger are always awesome! Always on point and attentive! You'll feel like a true King when you go to Jasmine Tea! THANK YOU for your great food! Love the coconut walnut shrimp and seasonal CRAB! YUM!
author: J M.

description: Wonderful Gluten Free American Chinese, wonderful comfort food. They're great with GF allergens.
author: L S.

description:
My family orders delivery from here all the time.

Broccoli beef, veggie fried rice, sweet and sour chicken, mu shu pork, combination wonton soup, spicy string beans, chow mein, crab rangoons, prawns in lobster sauce and garlic prawns. We've tried all of these and they're all delicious.

So glad they came back after re-modeling. My parents like the combo wonton soup the most. Big ups for the free chow mein or fried rice you get when you order 3 entrees.

Yaaay, Jasmine Tea House!
author: Lauren L.

description:
Definitely my go-to delivery place. They always deliver to my apartment in Glen Park in 30 minutes or less. 

Large portions of great tasting food. My favorites;
- Yangtze Spare Ribs. Big serving, super tender and seasoned.
- Fried chicken wings with some kinda sweet sauce on the side.
- Shrimp dumplings. 
- BBQ spare ribs.
- Spicy eggplant (w/shrimp and chicken) lunch special.
author: Ri H.

description: We ordered the General TSO chicken , Basil Chicken , chicken fried rice and pork dumplings and it was all great. They delivered and we were very happy to get a good meal.
author: Lynette D.

description: I really appreciate that Jasmine Tea House delivered a stellar meal to my front door on the night of "the storm of the decade".  Thank you JTH!
author: Nanasiri Sharon M.

description: I love this place! you know the place is unique when you arrive, at night the front of the building is a rainbow of neon. (decent parking too) I like to come here between work shifts just to relax as its generally very quiet and good wifi. The service is outstanding; very quick and friendly. The prices are cheap and the plates loaded. The food is sensuous and delicious with a good variety. The tea is hot and crisp served in a whole teapot. They even deliver. SOLID WONDERFUL PLACE!
author: Jason T.

description:
Dont order delivery from here through grubhub or call them. They'll either be super late with COLD food or wont show up at all. Dont bother arguing with the manager its pointless. 
if you want rude customer service, cold food or no food order here!
author: Roxanne K.

description: Highly recommend this place. Fast service, great food.
author: Lisa D.

description:
This review concerns the dim sum. We ordered the dim sum combination plate (shrimp dumplings, pork dumplings, and steamed bbq pork buns) as well as the chive dumplings and the steamed tofu roll. Everything was completely unimpressive, but not terrible tasting as to make it hard to eat. The first clue should have been that I was the only Asian customer in the entire place. But the food is passable for what we paid for it. 

We also ordered the garlic eggplant lunch special to split between three of us. The waitress was nice enough to give us three soups instead of the single one that comes with it when she guessed we were going to be splitting it. The eggplant sauce itself was quite sweet, but otherwise cooked decently.
author: Stephen C.

description: The food and service were great. Had the wonton soup and fried chicken wings. The only downside was the bathroom was disgusting.
author: Chad L.

description: The general's chicken lacked ANY kind of flavor. Not sure what the hype is about.
author: Greg J.

description:
So sad they closed..prob due to dweebs negative reviews here. Now, MY neighborhood will suffer with another overpric
ed pork restaurant...
author: shanestar h.

description: Good spot, they can go a little heavy on the oil and spice but we have been pleased with our meals here many times.
author: Phil L.

description: I used to LOVE this place. They had the best fake meat in town and other yummies but something dreadful has happened. They have been going downhill ever since they reopened and now it's so salty I can't eat it. At all. SAD  Seriously, I cannot imagine why anyplace would use so much salt.
author: LadyJ M.

description: Ordered lunch today because I have a cold and I swear their hot & sour soup is a cure all. I ordered their Kung pao chicken lunch special (comes with rice & hot/sour soup), pot stickers & crab ragoon. Really good!!
author: heather m.

description:
We have been dining at this place for many years.
We know the owner.
We have dined in and have had delivery.

The last time we ordered in the restaurant, the shrimp was so full of salt, that we could not eat the dish. He compensated but we will not be returning.

Why is is that everyone uses so much salt in their cooking?  It is terrible and unhealthy.
I hope the owner is reading this. But i figure he does not care.
author: rick l.

description: On the plus side, Jasmine delivers mostly quality chinese food quickly for a reasonable price. On the down side, I always seem to get one bad dish, which wouldn't be too bad if it was the same dishes. I thought I liked Asparagus in black bean sauce. Then, Sunday, I got a bunch of low grade asparagus in some sort of weak broth. What happened?
author: seth c.

description:
Ordered :
General Tsao Chicken Lunch Special : 5/5. Loved this
Noodles Lunch Special : 2/5 . Too much oil

Will order again : 4/5. Yes
author: Rachit A.

description:
Definitely tasty and well prepared food. Dim sum was delicious and I loved the potstickers. 

However, I ordered delivery and the food was late by around 20 minutes. If the food wasn't so delicious, I would have definitely been more upset. However, sinking my teeth into an affordable steamed pork bun just made me forget everything about the meal being late.
author: Brandon M.

description:
This review is based on only one takeout order, but I disliked everything in the order. Even the rice was disappointing. (It was mushy.) The other items - orange beef, egg roll, and hot and sour soup - just had a weird smell and flavor to me. Maybe just not to my taste.

The service was friendly enough when I went to pick it up.
author: Naomi D.

description:
Best Chinese Food in Bernal, Bitches!
The food is fresh, clean, not salty nor oily, and tasty! They deliver and they are friendly and quick to get you the food. I've never waited more than 30 mins for delivery. There is a great selection of vegetarian dishes, too, which is a plus for the non-vicious ones of us here, who don't kill cute animals in order to feed ourselves. I love the Happy Buddha dish, and you should get it! If nothing else, it's really fun to say.
author: Susan T.

description:
We tried it again and you know what, everything tastes the same.  It's like House of NanKing (aka House of Same Sauce) -  Broccoli beef - same sauce.  Mushu Chicken - same sauce.  Kung Pao Chicken - same sauce + hot peppers.  All tastes about the same. 

Also, the meat is strangely tender... I really liked it at first, but it made me wonder what kind of meat I was eating.  I just felt a bit weird about it, but give a try and see for yourself.  Not bad, but seriously, it's just a bit strange..... what DO they put in their food?  Just made me wonder is all.
author: Catherine H.

description: My boyfriend and I were walking around the neighborhood looking for a good lunch spot on 4th of July and came across this place. Didn't look impressive from the outside but it was surprisingly good! We ordered pork and vegetable Potstickers, I had the lunch size Sesame Chicken and he ordered the General Tsao Chicken. The meal came with complimentary hot and sour soup. Potstickers come in 4 and were yummy. Our chicken dishes were very similar. Crispy, breaded chicken pieces in a tangy sauce. His was more spicy than mine, but mine had sesame seeds. I wanted to finish my whole plate but after the big potstickers and soup, I was stuffed. Nothing more satisfying than a reasonably priced a hole in the wall Chinese spot!
author: Rochelle I.

description:
my dishes had top quality meat. They just had no idea how to prepare it.
Had the lobster shrimp. Fresh shrimp good mushrooms, in a soggy soup like concoction. 
Lemon chicken I sware had a lot of menthal in it. delicious high quality white meat chunks ruined with menthal flavor. 
Over all huge disapointment.....

one star after thinking mm atleast i'll have a delicious fortune cookie snack to finish the dispointing meal and i sware to you both cookies were burnt. Really did you just mess up a fortune cookie?
author: Jill F.

description:
Upon arrival my boyfriend & I were graciously greeted & seated side by side. I actually preferred that to across the table, which was a bit far and was glad the host had the foresight to seat us that way. It was evening and the lighting was dim, not dark, but perfect for evening dining.
Our order was taken & we opted for the veggie egg rolls to start. They were delish! My sweetie ordered the sesame beef which he seemed to enjoy (I don't eat meat, but he does & he devoured his dish!). The serving of his plate was very generous, as was mine. I ordered the mango shrimp which was devine! Both the shrimp and mangoes were perfectly cooked. The sauce did not take over the natural flavors and the brown rice I ordered complimented the dish well. In summary, service was outstanding, Americanized-style Chinese food was amazing and the price was totally worth it. We even had leftovers which made it even more worth it! I have been coming here for years and the above experience explains why. I gave them four stars ONLY because the food is not "authentic," Chinese, but going in knowing they are catering to Americans, I think it's pretty great!
author: Jasmine A.

description:
Sometimes, after a trying day all you need is a crab puff, an egg roll, a pot sticker, some fried chicken wings and a good friend to remind you that life's okay and maybe, just maybe, so are you. If the crab puff-egg roll-pot sticker-fried chicken wings solution is one you want to employ order the appetizer combination (the good friend you will have to find on your own.) Unlike in other Chinese restaurants, every single item on the plate is excellent.

Keep the good vibes going with a dish of dry sauteed string beans. They're flavorful and packed full of spice and pass the leftover test with flying colors. Chow mein is just okay and the Szechwan beef ought to be avoided - it was seriously disappointing.
author: Miriam W.

description:
I was in the mood for Chinese and I liked the name Jasmine Tea House when looking through my options for delivery on grubhub.

But the food did not live up to the name. I ate some of it, but ended up throwing the rest out. It was just that bad imo. I got the bok choy and mushrooms and the veggie sticky buns. Hardly any veggies in the sticky buns and the bok choy/mushrooms dish was overcooked and stale tasting.

I gave it two stars because the delivery guy was nice.
author: Shannon D.

description:
Update: I dig the meatless Kung Pao chicken - but the meatless Sesame  chicken takes it. That stuff is sesame sprinkled crack. So good^6 (to the power of 6).

I love Jasmine Tea House's Kung Pao fake chicken. The delivery wait can be long (sometimes VERY long), but everything I've had on the menu has been great, affordable, and friends are always bowled over by their extensive vegetarian selections. If you're feeling hung-over or run down -  a little dose of JTH can go a long way. Promise.
author: Jessica T.

description: dissapointed in the mango shrimp order I ate. it was tasteless and in essence just tasted like mangoes and shrimp.....thas it...no flavor, spices , anything! hmmmm 12 dollars for a flavorless entree? No thanks. maybe an off night. but I think Ill pass next time.
author: Christina M.

description:
R.I.P.

will miss your basil ostrich, walnut prawns and black pepper cube steak or beef or whatever it was
author: Scotty B.

description:
Let's admit it bernal...this place has past it's time.  I have gone in intervals over the yrs, it's done.  Recently spent $18+ on burnt stale fried rice and oily veggies, and nothing was recommended when I called (when rice is bad, o how low do you need to go?).  So another shot... Lunch!  Btw, you can order from the dinner menu for lunch (kind of nice if lunch menu referenced it).  Snow peas prawns with brown rice please.  "lunch special menu snow peas prawns and rice rce or dinner menu side rice?" huh?  I would like rice with my lunch special..."have you ordered lunch here before? a little defensively? No, dinner only. "have you ever ordered Chinese lunch?". Click.

This is the Mission and you are not hard  pressed to find delicious food and helpful service in a mix of price pts.   There is no need to work so hard at a crack at thawed smart and final chicken type- parts with sweet and sour sauce from a gelatinous can and getting one upped like a slap in the face for trying to order lunch.  Moving on
author: Camille T.

description:
NO idea how this place has good reviews. over an hour for delivery, food was lukewarm, mushy, looked and tasted like it was sitting in a car trunk for an hour.
disgusting.

had: 
hot and sour soup...not spicy, mainly full of tofu and no other veggies
vegetable potstickers- too doughy
general tsao meatless chicken- like canned dog food.
fried rice- no vegetables, mainly rice with soy sauce.

even my soda was warm.
sad, sad, sad.

will yum yum house PLEASE come back to the mission?  : (
author: Little P.

description: Great food, great service, and reasonable prices. This restaurant will be my go to Chinese delivery place whenever I'm in the mood for delicious food :)
author: M B.

description:
I dislike giving low scores... But this place really can't do better than three stars.

The waitress was rude, as if customers were a burden.

I had the hot and sour soup, which was neither hot nor sour. It was too sweet.

I'm not impressed with this place. Does not live up to the other reviews. I am giving it three stars (instead of two) because I only ordered two bowls of soup -- so I can't judge the other food.
author: Ellie M.

description:
Garlic eggplant is divine.  So is their general tsao chicken & chicken with string beans (very crispy).

Lunch specials are a whopping $5.25 DELIVERED FREE to your office if you're close enough!  Oh ya!
author: Athena S.
