description: Great place with no bells and whistles. Dishes are tasty. shrimp dumplings, the wraps. Service is a little bizarre at times but the price is right if you a hearty eater
author: Sigorney S.

description:
Seriously think our kung pao chicken was more like kung pao kitty. Texture was so off it turned us off. Will say the hot & sour soup was tasty, and the onion pancake was fine, too. But the chicken turned us away for life. 

And the search for cheap hunan style amazing chinese continues....
author: Sital P.

description: One of the tastiest Chinese joints in town. I frequent Jasmine Tea House quite often, a I live across the street. I've really gotten to know the owner and his family, who are all super friendly and know what I typically order. They have awesome veggie options (sweet and sour meatless chicken, or kung pao meatless chicken, for example). And the price is right for Chinese in this city - ou get alot of food for the price.  And the bonus is that they don't use MSG in the food, as I've requested many times for them not to put it in only for them to remind me constantly that they don't use it.  :-)
author: Michael M.

description:
Haven't always been a fan of cheap Chinese food.  

In my early 20's, a bout of food poisoning caused by a bunk dose of chow mein forced me to miss a NYE rave in East Oakland.  Tragic.

In my mid 20's, an unclean batch of sweet 'n sour shrimps forced me to miss a cozy evening chez the CEO of a local tech company. Tragedy of all tragedies. 

Have kept an open mind re: cheap Chinese for the following reasons - 

* During the course of single motherhood, there've been quite a few nights when I could scarcely muster the energy to open a box of mac 'n cheese for the kids. (K, lots of nights.)

* Secondly, my youngest adores anything Chinese.  Pretty sure this has something to do with Kai Lan, adorable cartoon cousin of Dora the Explorer.  On any given night, ask her what she wants for dinner, and the answer will always be "Chinese."

Jasmine Tea House is our go-to Chinese because: a) they deliver, b) they're cheap, c) plenty of vegetarian options, and d) they offer dim sum for dinner. 

Have never had a bad meal from this joint, and my newly miserly ways allow me to stretch a $30 dinner for three days.

Thank you, Jasmine Tea House!
author: Kati K.

description: lets not kid ourselves, this place isn't very authentic but its good at what it does. Legend has it Bill Clinton ordered from here a couple of times (before he went on that vegan diet.)
author: Julia M.

description:
DIM SUM MECCA.

For about two years, off and on, we have sought the perfect combination for Dim Sum. This being:
1) Not over-priced (Yank Sing I'm talkin to you)
2) No questionable ingredients (what meat is this again/is this gray matter meat?)
3) No 45 minute wait for a table (Eh hem Hong Kong Lounge)

This quest has taken us to some very expensive and to some very sketchy, "wow, there are pigeon feathers all over the floor" type establishments.  I think we have struck gold at Jasmine Tea House. 

The Dim Sum here was all super fresh made with quality ingredients (my god, that really is shrimp in there!) and shockingly/sadly we were the only patrons in the restaurant - maybe because it was the 4th of July. 

What we had that was awesome:
Shrimp Dumplings
Pork Siu Mai
Vegetable Dumplings (Meatless chicken and spinach I believe)
Stuffed Eggplant (aaaamazing)
Sesame Ball

Sweet Rice (just okay)

The only thing they're missing from the menu is shanghai soup dumplings. We will be back!
author: H.S. G.

description:
The food here is inconsistent, but consistently below average. I work close to here, so am periodically lulled by by promises of a close takeout lunch.  I've been surprised, but never pleasantly.

Today I had hot and sour soup, which (this time) was oddly not the remotest bit hot or sour.  You don't want to know what the hot and sour flavors (had they been there) cover up in this soup.

I've also recently eaten the Mongoian Beef and the Kung Pao Chicken, both of which lacked any culinary luster.

You might ask "whaddaya expect for a $5 lunch?"  Indeed. This is one place that puts the test to that question - and sends it shuffling home, wishing it had studied more.
author: Colin S.

description:
My favorite Chinese place in SF by far!

Located right near my house and the food is always delivered to me super fast!

Tastes great and is an amazing bang for your buck!

HIGHLY recommended!!!! 

5 stars!!!
author: Alexis N.

description:
My boyfriend and i ordered for delivery over the phone... 
the lady who took our order spoke and understood English VERY WELL! from past experiences... it was ALL bad attempting to order food from people you can hardly understand! O_O

BUT ANYWAYS!

We ordered the walnut prawns, sesame chicken, and combination fried rice.. the walnut prawns were pretty darn good... sesame chicken was BOMB! but combo. fried rice was "ehhhh" /= wasn't all that... price came up to $20 somethin.. not THAT bad, i guess

4 stars for pretty good food!
author: Chelsey B.

description: I was lazy to cook and walked by this place several times, saw that President Bill Clinton at there so if it's good enough for Bill it's good enough for me, Right? Well I'm Chinese and I've eaten lots of Chinese food in my life and this place is ok but not presidential standards. I ordered the korean chicken, which was heavily battered. The batter was so thick I was eating just batter at one point. The chicken was very meaty which I liked and the sauce looked scary kind of a very dark soy color but it wasn't overwhelming, not too sweet, not too salty. The Mopo tofu was good, nice firm tofu. I think they used a fermented tofu which is stiffer, but I could be wrong. Free beef chow mein was bland. it looks very saucy but it was bland, I added hot sauce to it and it tasted better. That's it.
author: Karen T.

description:
Let's not kid ourselves here.  Get the General Tso's meatless chicken.  You'll weep.  

Lightning fast delivery.
author: Sophia R.

description:
Yuck. That is pretty much all I have to say.

I am not proud of my order but even so.. ewwww.

Hong Kong Noodles: big greasy mush with too much sauce and a mix of everything. You could barely tell what was what.

Sweet & Sour Pork: All batter, not crispy AT ALL and barely any pork that was super chewy.

Walnut Shrimp: Too much sauce and all batter as well. 


Dim Sum:
- steamed pork buns - SOO much bun, barely any pork and not that flavorful.
- bbq pork - pastry was dense and chewy.
- shrimp dumplings - the dumpling part was SO thick.

Hands down - the grossest place I have ordered from for chinese delivery.
author: Liz S.

description:
BEST WONTON SOUP EVER!@#

Everything else is pretty good too. not quite "normal" chinese food, but supper yummy and fairly priced.
author: Ross W.

description: Yes, I was hungry and lazy.  Eat 24 says this place was good. Yelp says this place was good. I ordered Dim Sum (pork siu mai and hai gow plus HK panned fried noodles)  The Dim Sum, especially the Pork Siu Mai was excellent.  Meat was tasty, lean, and( no gristle that sometimes lesser quality places make you discover).  What was great about the pan fried noodles was the meat/vegetables/sauce was stored in separate container from the crispy noodles. No soggy chowmein but delicious crispy noodles.  I ordered it with Chinese Brocoli and they had it!!  They did not skimp on the beef.  Plenty of meat unlike other places.  And because they delivered on time the sauce was piping hot!  Translation excellent quality, fast delivery.  I was so impressed by their lunch delivery I plan on ordering dinner tonight.  This time I will pick up but I am sure it will be good. Yelpers if you like good quality dim sum this is a good place. Now not everything I ordered from this place was good.  I ordered the fried appetizer combo (shrimp chips, pot stickers, egg rolls) That was not so good but that was more my fault for selecting a more "American Style" Chinese dish.  And yea I am Asian too so go figure.
author: Dwight S.

description:
It's pricey for Chinese food but it's just so good I wouldn't mind forking out the extra bucks. Everyone raves about their "fake chicken". Why eat fake when you can have the real thing? I love their General Chou's chicken. You can actually identify it as chicken rather than fried batter covered in sauce. Overall, I like.

JONASAPPROVED!
author: Jonas T.

description: I was really impressed with the customer service at Jasmine.  My husband and I always joke that our secret plan as a business would be to make little mistakes and then apologize profusely for them, but it's true - you really notice and appreciate good customer service when someone makes an error.  Jasmine forgot to deliver my mu shu pork, and when I called about it, before I could finish the guy was calling in a new order and promising that it would get to me immediately - and sure enough, less than 20 minutes later, the missing item had arrived.  The food was solid all around, really delicious, but what made my experience and will make me a repeat customer was their eagerness to rectify a mistake.  They didn't even seem remotely annoyed - genuinely eager to please.  Props to you, Jasmine!
author: Rebecca K.

description:
This is a nice spot. Better than a lot of Chinese vegan options. Not sure why it doesn't get frequented as much by the vegan masses that I know.

The meatless chicken dishes are great. It is their own chicken analog so the originality is a plus. Flavorful and good portions. Quite a selection of dishes as well. Plus, they got some vegan dim sum.

The staff were real friendly too.

I recommend all my friends to go here!
author: shane s.

description:
In the spirit of FB--10 random things you didn't know about my dim sum experience at Jasmine Tea House:

1) i love their colorful, neon lights that read "Jasmine"-- it makes me super excited for dim sum.
2) our waiter was extremely friendly, like genuinely friendly & patient--he gets 10 stars!
3) i brought three of my favorite ladies for lunch
4) one of whom is a vegetarian (or rather pescatarian, i guess)
5) we ordered chicken chow mein (which was outstanding) & vegetable soup 
6) and every dim sum item you can imagine: shrimp dumplings, chive dumplings, BBQ pork buns, shu mai, sticky rice with meatless chicken (highly recommend this one), vegetable dumplings & buns, & the fried prawn appetizer
7) we adored the tiny tea cups
8) and the delicious jasmine tea to help digest all that not-that-heavy-but-still-kinda-heavy Chinese food
9) everything was about $11 per person (not including tip)
10) my fortune read "the current year will bring you much happiness." 

Do you feel you know me better now?
author: Fancypants X.

description:
Veggie chicken! Good veggie chicken! However, it is easy to go a little overboard on the deep fried food (the faux chicken is breaded and fried) when ordering...balance the deep fried with a strictly veggie dish if you don't want to feel like you are trying to digest a boulder.

Personal favorites: onion pancakes, happy buddha (best balance of veggies, tofu and veggie chicken) and general tsao's veggie chicken.
author: Leslie T.

description:
THEN- Jasmine Tea House was my very favorite Chinese Restaurant for years in my neighborhood. Frank and Alex were like wise Buddhist monks  disguised as waiters. The vibe in the place was always peaceful and very unlike most inmpersonal Chinese restaurants . Frank and Alex were great to talk to and remembered things about you and your family. The very best lunch with some great signature dishes like Happy Buddha and fast delivery.
NOW- Mysteriously Jasmine Tea House closed last year FOR MONTHS without warning . I was freaked out as I eat there alot and order take-out  from them weekly . 
Recently it reopened after "remodeling". All it looked like had happened was a good wash and a fresh coat of paint ,otherwise exactly the same - EXCEPT no Frank or Alex! All new people . 
It is now like any other unpleasant Chinese restaurant. With the exception of the now owner (who has always been a smiling face and kind presence), the waiters treat you like a foreign  object , loud screaming across the room in Cantonese ( like fingernails on a chalkboard) Dirty dishes in bins in the main dining area . I sat waiting for my check (for the first time in JTH history ) while the only waitress yakked away on the phone for a very long time (even though there must have been 15 people in the room and the kitchen.)
The peace and serenity of the old Jasmine Tea House atmosphere has left the building (and gone with Frank to BIG LANTERN on 3170 16th St. and Valencia.)
author: Esmerelda K.

description:
This place is amazing! It's well known that Bill Clinton considers it the best Chinese restaurant in town, and so do my friends in the area and my entire household.

The meatless sesame chicken always hits the spot, as does the Happy Buddha and the veggie potstickers. My carnivore friends adore the duck, but as I'm a vegetarian I can't speak for that myself.

We often order delivery, but dining there is also an easy way to catch  up with my friends in the neighborhood. They have a bottle of a superb French red wine for only $15!!  Who can beat that?

The staff are all way nice to us, and even go out of their way to make us feel like special customers.  I consider myself fortunate that the Jasmine Tea House is so close to me. Thanks, guys!!
author: Tracy B.

description:
This review is for delivery; I haven't eaten in. We ordered broccoli beef and kung pao chicken on Eat 24. We received broccoli beef and mixed veggies. We called up and they said they'd send over the kung pao. 

We ate the broccoli beef, and so it was through an MSG-induced fog I witnessed the following: 

After an additional 45 minutes delivery man returns with kung pao chicken and a bill. 

My husband says, you brought this because the first time you brought us something we didn't order. 

Delivery man says you have to pay. 

My husband calls Jasmine Tea House again and says, "your delivery man is here with the kung pao chicken you didn't bring the first time around and a bill." 

Woman on phone says to my husband, "let me talk to delivery man." 

My husband hands his cell phone to delivery man. 

Conversation in Chinese.

Delivery man hands back the cell phone, and says, "I have to take this back."

So he took it back.

Maybe when the MSG wears off I won't think this was on the cusp of customer abuse. We'll see.
author: schmarie b.

description: Jasmine Tea House changed management in approx late 2010. One of the two managers moved to Big Lantern on 16th St and took with him all the magic of Jasmine Tea House including faux chicken dishes and ect. Skip Jasmine Tea House and try the new Big Lantern.
author: Shannon Z.

description:
DEEEELICIOUS soy chicken. I have never been to the actual location but they are perfect for those really cold evenings because they'll deliver right to my door. (I'm lazy, I know.) 

I wouldn't recommend the Chinese broccoli .... it's like just the stems of broccoli... that's what it tastes like to me anyway. Maybe you're into that. I'm not.
author: Natasha P.

description:
I don't live in Twin Peaks anymore, but I still order delivery from here at least twice a month. Which isn't awesome for my girlish figure but I just don't care.

A couple weeks ago I ordered some delivery.  It wasn't until they were at my door that I realized that I didn't have any cash or credits cards on me.  I was at a friend's house doing laundry and totally spaced on the details. Would you believe that they still left me with my order because they said they trusted me and remembered my hungry face from months back.  I jotted down my cc number and they told me to call back with the rest of the information when I returned home.

My only quarrel remains that after two years of calling in, you'd think they have some sort of system where they know all your information and all you have to do is just say what you want...
author: Mennlay A.

description:
Jasmine Tea House...I love you!!! Muwaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaah!

This charming little place, in the Mission a coupla blocks from Army/Caesar Chavez...is one of my fave places in SF to eat.
I have never ordered food for delivery, have always dined in...and why not when it's such a welcoming, airy energy... nice tables and chairs...it's not another chipped tile/plastic table/fluorescent lighting spots!  ..It seems to be a favorite stop of many uniformed (and un-uniformed SFPD) so better watch your manners and don't poke anyone with your chopsticks...unless they ask I guess...

Anyway, here's a rundown of some of my favorite items:

Any of the dumplings.....***5 stars

Sizzling soup or Combo won ton soup*****5 stars

Chicken salad......**4.5 stars

General Tsao chicken....** 5 Stars

Jasmine prawns....**10 stars

Happy Buddha (wonderful veggie dish)  ***10 stars

Basil Ostrich (yes, I said ostrich)  ***5 stars

Service is always ** 5 stars!!

You can get lucky with street parking...but the good news is there is a lot  RIGHT across the street  that usually has space and not too $$..and heck for the convenience, so worth it!!  
(And if you do park in the lot, remember, it's much easier to jay walk from the lot to JTH...watch out for the fast moving cars or coppers,  Chachi...beep beep!!!!!)

Have fun!!! Mangia la ostrich!!!
author: Karen S.

description: Their Korean chicken wings are absolutely ridiculous!  I'm a huge wings fan and I think these are the best in the city.  Other things are okay, but make sure you get the wings. Also, the portions are really generous.
author: Arik L.

description:
We ordered the "Treat Yourself" combination dinner - with Orange Beef and Sauteed Calamari. 

The food arrived lukewarm. The fixings: eggroll, hot sour soup were all good. The food: Orange Beef was flavourful, the Sauteed Calamari fishy and bad. The calamari dish caused 'one illness' the day after.

In reading reviews from Jasmine Tea House, it seems that seafood is best avoided.
author: Kent H Y.

description:
Meh.  I've experienced ALOT better.  So... I was feeling chinese so i looked up Mission Delivery Chinese on Yelp.com.  You guys were raving about how good the food is so I said "Let's do it!"  That was my bad.  The service was fine [the chick on the phone was cool, the delivery guy was fast and cool] however, the food was not the best.  

It seemed thrown together, didn't taste like fresh chopped veggies, and was oily overall tho I didn't have any fried entrees.

My roommate says they should change their name to "Five Star Chinese" in the name of irony.  He all but spit out the egg roll.  

Today, I thought "maybe it was me.  maybe I didn't give it a chance (and I had already spent  36 bucks on the order)

Today, I thought the leftovers might be better.  It was still lackluster.  Sorry Jasmine Tea House, once was enough.
author: Jonathan B.

description: My sister introduced me to this place. I absolutely love it. Friends of mine are not as in love as I am, but I think you have to know what to order. My sister loves their dim sum and recommends it. I personally think their mongolian beef is some of the best in the city. Their crab rangoons, general tsao chicken, BBQ pork fried rice, hong kong style chow mein, and garlic prawns are also some of my favorites.
author: Bernadette R.

description:
Q: Are you sure they have fake sesame chicken?
A: Yeah I read it on Yelp, they said it was good. 
Q But it's not on the menu.
A: I'll just order it.
Q: Okay? if you say so. 

They do have it! It wasn't on the menu when we were in there, but you can order it, and its good. Score one for yelp! We actually ordered a lot of food and were about to order more, but we stopped ourselves, even the waiter thought that was a "good idea". By the way, the waiter was very nice and he pours water like a super hero with one hand on his hip. Can't wait to go back there and try their other dishes.
author: Theresa D.

description:
5 STARS - Baby!

Great food and great people that run this place...looking forward to their opening.  

Jasmine Tea House will be opening after the new year 2012.  I spoke with one of the owners today 12/18...He said that they'd be opening sometime after the new years.  I actually stepped inside the place and spoke with Robert.  Very nice and cordial owners.

The Jasmine Tea House neon sign was lit up too!

Look for them to open soon!
author: Richard J.

description: Methinks this place bought from family member. It used to be very tasty but new owners are subpar. I surmise restaurant name & recipes were bought. New cooks have no talent. Food is salty but flavorless. I imagine that Panda Express tastes better. Don't waste your time with this place. They are trying to ride on the coat tails of the prior owners and reviews!
author: Rude G.

description:
My boyfriend and I go through phases when it comes to good restaurants. We just can't stay away. We decide to go out for dinner, and somehow, we always end up back in the same spot we were the week before.

We had our phase with Jasmine Tea house about 6 months ago. I love their Seafood Chow Fun, their Happy Buddha, and I'm especially fond of any Chinese restaurant that serves tasty dim sum as an appetizer. We brought friends, and it was even Chinese-Friend-Lynn-Approved (CFLA). 

Anyway, long story short- Our Jasmine Tea house phase came to a close, and we moved on to Murasaki across the city. Today we decided to stop back in, on a whim... And it was just how I remembered it. Excellent food, excellent service, excellent price. I even discovered a new dish that I just love: Sesame beef (substitute vegetarian chicken and its veggie-friendly). 

One last positive note on Jasmine Tea house: They are always so kind. One time I was taking my boyfriend on a surprise picnic with Jasmine food, and they packed to-go tea at my request. Today, in my clumsiness, I knocked over a glass of water, spilling everywhere. Instead of acting annoyed, the waitress fervently sopped up the mess and even refilled my glass!!!

In conclusion... Although our Jasmine Tea House fixation has come to a close, it will always have a place in my heart....
author: Erin M.

description:
Wow. I really can't believe how bad the food was.

We ordered online, and while the delivery was prompt, the food was absolutely atrocious. I had the basil tofu, and my boyfriend had the general tso's chicken. Both dishes were bland and salty. The general tso's chicken was sticky and mushy. Every other chinese restaurant where I've had either of those dishes, they were spicy. Not to mention that the online ordering didn't offer an option to add steamed rice, and I foolishly thought it would come with it if it wasn't a menu option. We got no rice whatsoever.

I certainly won't be ordering again.
author: April S.

description: We ordered take out after they left a flyer on our door. That is not something I'd normally do but I was lazy. We ordered the mixed vegetables and kung pao chicken. The vegetables had good flavor but they were overcooked and super mushy which kind of put me off. The kung pao chicken was standard, good enough to eat but not good enough to get seconds. If you order two entrees you get free chow mein or fried rice. We went with the chow mein and it was pretty bland until i put the kung pao sauce on it. The delivery guy makes up for some of this because I have never had a more friendly, happy delivery person!
author: Jackie O.

description: Love this place and have been going here for years.  However, they recently hired someone who obviously can't man the phones.  When I call for delivery, she regularly puts me on hold and then hangs up on me.  In addition, she will put me on hold, but not mute the phone and go back to the other line and repeat the customer's credit card number out loud and I can hear it clearly (good thing I'm honest!).  If this only happened once I would let it slide, but both these experiences have happened multiple times.  Now I just expect it!
author: Yogini R.

description: We went around 4PM on a Monday and we were the only ones.  The service was very fast and good.  We had pork and shrimp dumplings that were very good, along with some white wine.  We were fully so we took the chicken cashew and chicken garlic with brown rice dishes home. They were really good.  We ordered the main dishes from the lunch menu, and the price was very good.  I will definitely be back.
author: Marni S.

description: great place to eat with great service, we definitely recommend trying a dine in and try the dim sum. they also deliver.
author: Cory B.

description:
Jasmine Tea House is by far the cleanest most delicious "Chinese" restaurant in that block of the Mission. I quoted the word Chinese because there are so many restaurants based on various regional and fusion cooking techniques.

The locality is well lit, clean, and nicely decorated. It is also easy to get to and park. There is a public parking lot across the street in the B of A lot. The food is not greasy or stuffed with MSG. The dishes vary from the simple americanized dishes like beef broccoli to the culinary rarities such as frog legs.

The dishes I recommend are the Moo shu pork (chinese tacos), walnut prawns, hunan fish, frog legs, ostrich and vegetables, and for desert, fried bananas with green tea ice cream from Mitchell's.
author: Humano T.

description:
Strong odor + weird aftertaste + headache afterwards = NO return business

I ordered from them other day because I didn't want to pick up from Eric's and wanted to try something new for Chinese delivery besides Wild Pepper.  Bad idea!  I remember another Yelper mentioning something about a funky taste/aftertaste, and it's so true!  I should have known the moment the delivery guy handed me the bag, and all I could smell was a strong salty, dried shrimp odor!

The food tasted OK but I couldn't get over the overpowering smell and the stagnant aftertaste it left behind.  My fried rice was really dry and uneven in color.  You can tell they threw it in the wok, poured soy sauce over the whole thing, but didn't care if everything got evenly distributed!  Lame!  Maybe that's why they give it to you for free with 2 entree orders.

One good thing: the General Tso's Chicken was great because (and I'd never seen this) they use humongous chunks of chicken but include the deep fried batter stuff separately interspersed within the dish.  That way you can eat as little or as much deep fried batter as you want.  And of course, I like to eat all of it!  Genious!!!  But the weird aftertaste still permeated in this dish too, even over the delicious Tso sauce!  Gosh darnit!

I still love you Bill Clinton!
author: Vicente G.

description: Great place! Delivery  took about 15 mins longer than they said it would. The pork bun I got had burned meat. The chow main is the best! Their mu shu is great and Lemon chicken is awesome. Hot and sour soup is some of the best :-)
author: Tabitha F.

description: Greasy food. Well it is Chinese but it all tastes the same
author: Pablo H.

description:
This is my go-to Chinese restaurant and has been for many years. I have turned A LOT of people on to this place and they have also become loyal to jasmine tea house. I love their vegetarian food but overall there is a bit of inconsistency. I would say though, that the majority of the food is great and I haven't had a problem with food when dining in.

Their dim sum is good.
Meatless chicken is a must try and my favorite (general tsao)
My boyfriend is obsessed with the combination won ton soup and recommends getting a large.
author: Gabi R.

description:
I usually don't like eating out for chinese food other than dimsum.  It's embarrassing because I can make it myself or eat at my mommy's.  But I've been too lazy to cook or drive all the way home, and definitely craving some chinese food, so I stopped by here for lunch today with my friend.

Starting with the atmosphere.  The place was pretty open and wasn't too crowded.  There was a lot of in and outs for take out and what not. Atmosphere was nice, not too quiet but enough for me and my friend to have a chatty lunch without everybody in there hearing our convo.

We ordered the bak choy with black mushrooms and basil chicken, and their dimsum combination plate.  The food was pretty good.  The dimsum wasn't the BEST EVER kind of deal, but definitely up to par.  (I'm Cantonese, I grew up eating dimsum in China, so I would know =P).  

Anyways, the basil chicken, really was basil chicken, it's really Americanized ( my friend ordered this, I would probably have never ordered it), but it tasted like what it says it is, BASIL and CHICKEN...lol the texture was good and the flavor was really basil-ish... wouldn't get that again...but it's not BAD...

The bak choy and black mushrooms was pretty good.  I wish they gave you more bak choy, I was really craving the vegetables, but then they weren't stingy with the mushrooms.  You can tell they used some oyster sauce for the mushrooms and it was really good.  It's a simple, common, easy to make dish, and it was well made. 

The service is pretty good.  Fast and polite, and she was actually really nice.  I asked her for extra rice to go, we had left overs which i was going to bring to my boyfriend at work, and she gave me a whole to go box and she didn't charge me for it, or give me a dirty look which I feel like other places often do when you ask for stuff.  I was gonna give it 3 stars but because of that I'll give it an extra star! It's not about getting free stuff, it's about the fact that she quickly and nicely gave me what I wanted.

Anyways, the only thing bad about the place is that when she first brought out the plate she didn't realize that one of them was still dirty...it had something crusty on it, eww.  But we told her and she apologized and quickly gave us a clean and new one.  

I think I'm being so nice about this because they were truly really nice and were service oriented, and places like that I can definitely be more forgiving about stuff.  4 stars overall and I'd definitely go back again.
author: Zu W.

description:
I like Bill Clinton.  I like food.  Bill Clinton likes food. Bill Clinton likes this place.  Thus, I thought odds were pretty good that I'd like this place... it was not to be.

We ordered delivery on Saturday at 6pm through a rather surly phone guy who spoke reasonable english.  The order showed up at 7:15pm, which I actually consider fine for a Saturday peak-dinner-delivery-time.  Despite the wait, the food did show up hot.

We ordered:
C. Party Time [Prawn with walnut]
There was at least a quarter inch of batter fried onto each prawn.  My wife ate this one -- she said it was pretty bland.  The hot & sour soup that came with it was really inedible -- it tasted like someone had accidentally spilled apple vinegar into it.  An obscene amount of apple vinegar.

36. Combination Wonton Soup
The soup had a decidedly fishy taste to it -- not what I was expecting.  Even after fishing out the prawns, I couldn't get past the fishy taste.  The pork in it was pretty good, as were the dumplings -- but the broth, prawns and chicken were pretty nasty looking and tasting.

60. General Tsao Chicken
Probably my favorite of the dishes.  Nice tangy black sauce, basted onto minimally breaded breast-meat chicken.  This could possibly be my new favorite General Tsao Chicken in SF, and the reason why they got 2 stars instead of 1.  There was a laughably small amount of broccoli in the container - I think one or two pieces.

70. Szechwan Beef
Again, a heavy hand was used with the batter, pre-frying.  The beef had very little flavor, but the cooked onions they threw in were a really nice addition to give the dish some kick.  

For $46 (including delivery tip), we'd have been better off ordering from somewhere else.
author: Paul L.

description:
Only OK...
 
Pros: Delivery; you can order online. I did think the hot and sour soup was quite good--peppery, and I didn't see that mystery meat I usually find in hot and sour soup. The egg rolls were also pretty good. The price was reasonable, though not super-cheap either.

Cons: I ordered a combination dinner with walnut prawns, after reading on here that the walnut prawns were good. I did not know they were going to be deep-fried. (There was no description on the menu.) I had in mind some kind of saute with a sauce and maybe some veggies in it...nope. Just deep-fried shrimp tossed in some kind of sweet-ish sauce with a handful of walnuts on top. I really loathe deep-fried Chinese food (be it sweet and sour chicken, etc.) --it is just so heavy and greasy and tasteless to me. So I was very disappointed by that. I do not want to judge the rest of the menu too harshly, as the soup and egg rolls were tasty. Maybe if I had ordered something different that wasn't fried I would have liked it. I just wish it had specified on the menu that it was fried. I would have chosen something else.
The other con (and unfortunately this affected the parts of my meal I DID enjoy) was that there were no little crunchy wontons to put in my soup, and no little packets of Chinese mustard or sweet and sour sauce for the egg rolls...not even a little packet of soy sauce. Nothing. I don't know if that is standard for this place or if they just forgot on my order, but I missed the crunchy things in my soup and I really like mixing some mustard and duck sauce for my egg roll. :-(

So...ummm...I don't want to judge too harshly, but I personally didn't feel like finishing my meal (though to be fair, after 2 egg rolls and a soup, you really can't eat more than a couple of deep-fried shrimp anyway)...
author: Jennie S.

description:
Service: 4/5
Food: 4/5
Wait: 5/5
Price: $
Presentation of food: 5/5
Presentation of restaurant: 4/5
Overall: 4/5

My favorite Chinese Food joint of all time, i'm not that big of a fan of Chinese food (since i eat this all my life); but i wouldn't mind me some Jasmine Teahouse. Esp. Chicken fried rice or Chicken Chowmein, or even their Beef with Oyster Sauce! yummm.
author: Eva H.

description:
The key thing about Jasmine Tea House, I believe, is the fact that it is *actually* a tea house. As in, they have a decent selection of loose-leaf teas that you can order by the pot. None of that the mass-packaged blase stuff other asian resturants get by the crate at Costco. I frequently come for some "linner" (Or "Second Brunch", as I like to think of it) and order a pot of tea and some dim sum and hang out with a book for awhile.

The regular food is excellent as well, the service is fast and friendly. Every time I have been there, a man who I believe is the owner is the one who has taken my order and served me. I like seeing such hands-on commitment to an establishment.
author: Colleen O.

description:
In addition to my original review of the eat-in service, I've now ordered delivery from them several times - they were pretty fast, and always accurate, and they took care in how they packaged the food.  

One important piece of advice: if you order 2 or more main courses, you get a free fried rice or noodle dish, but you have to ask.  So ask away.
author: Zachary R.

description: I just ordered a meal from them and extremely disappointed. Their chicken wings are disgusting.  It's all batter with oil.  Their chicken fried rice is equally disappointing.  Not sure how they can mess up a dish like that but they figured out a way.  Lastly their delivery service was 45 minute late.
author: Freddy M.

description:
This has been my favorite chinese restaurant hands down since moving out to San Francisco from New York in 2008. Their prices are reasonable and the staff is incredibly friendly and competent--my water glass never goes empty, which is very important to me in a restaurant. Food comes quickly and is always hot and I have never had to wait for a table, which means it's not crowded or noisy.

And let's talk about the food. I haven't tried any of their meat dishes except the ostrich (which is freakin amazing), but I've loved everything else (especially the sesame meatless chicken, veg potstickers, hot & sour soup, & veg mushu). I find that some dishes have the over-saltiness or over-greasiness that many chinese take-out type places have, although it is very slight here (I may be extra-sensitive to this because I do a ton of chinese cooking at home and I use much less oil). But, that's easily solved by asking your waiter for less oil or less salt or whatever you want and they will do it! 

Their meatless chicken is AMAZING and you can ask for it in the style of pretty much any of their chicken dishes even if it's not on the menu. I also like to ask for the meatless chicken not breaded or fried because it's much healthier that way, plus I like it better anyway. Basically, they will allow you to ask for substitutes or changes to their menu (within reason) without even frowning about it, so that alone wins them a ton of points in my book. Add tofu to your veggie dish, or eliminate those darn water chestnuts from your basil chicken. Go crazy!

As an added bonus, they give you a free lo/chow mein or fried rice if you order 2 entrees from take-out. And delivery is free. Love this place.
author: Katie D.

description: I am very picky when it comes to eating Chinese food. Let me tell you that the Jasmine Tea House makes the best Won Ton soup that I have ever tasted, and I have had my fair share. Their lunch specials are also delicious and fairly priced. But best of all is their customer service. Nothing better than being treated like family. The owner always asks about my son and how work is going. That kind of service goes very far.
author: Marcy K.

description: I should start off by saying that usually I am not a fan of Chinese food. However, I have been looking for new places that will deliver. So, when I found their menu on my door last night I decided to give them a try. I ate at the restaurant for lunch today and I was happy with my meal. The restaurant is clean and our waitress was really nice. We ordered Vegetable buns, salted string beans, sesame chicken, and lemon chicken. I loved that there was plenty of fresh green vegetables in everything we ordered and the portions were huge!!! We have enough leftovers for the dinner for two tomorrow and the best part is that our bill came out to be $25. Very happy to have found them, and will definitely be ordering delivery soon.
author: Sarah k.

description: Yay!  Their remodeling is over and they are back in business!!!!
author: Dwayne R.

description:
Everything was going great... until one of the cooks went into the restroom and didn't wash his hands (when you hear the toilet flush and then the cook comes out a split second later is DEFINITELY a bad sign). 

I will not be coming back here again, and it's a shame since their food was pretty good. :(
author: Abraham L.

description: I'm in the excelsior in sf and we have LOTS of chinese places here, but few are any that good, especially when it comes to delivery.  I ordered mine today around 1pm, attracted by the lunch special prices and the yelp reviews and I can say I was NOT disappointed.  As one reviewer wrote, the shrimp dumplings were of high quality with thin sleek dumpling shells even if they were small.  I was already pretty full and still had to devour their wonderful hunan lamb lunch special and sweet & sour pork lunch special (which came in surprisingly sturdy plastic ware sets instead of the usual chinese takeout cardboard boxes).  I was curious about the korean chicken wings because I absolutely love joe's excellent chinese cuisine version and it tasted different from joe's but was just as good with a crunchier batter over the  wings, kind of pricey with 11 wings for $11 but still, I felt satisfied.  The dishes are as another reviewer wrote mainly ABC food (american born chinese) tasting food like joe's.  The dishes came in good time in only 25 min after ordering online from their website.  They give you more than enough of a generous serving to make you full, which to me is the main reason, as well as giving you tasty food, for a restaurant to exist.  Over all, the dishes were excellent and yes, I would order for delivery from here again.
author: Frugal C.

description:
wow. i had such a horrible communication with them. they cancelled my order because of delivery issues and didn't let me know. I was very pissed about it. 

the restaurant owner, Robert, called and talked with me multiple times over the course of an hour and it became clear to me that he was committed to trying to find a winning solution for us both even though i was being bitchy. 

i appreciate his efforts to really work things out and if this were a customer service review, ultimately, i'd have to give it 5 stars. :) 

as for the food, some is kind of greasy and eh. 

but i LOVE the sizzling rice soup -- best i've ever had and some of the best soup i've had in SF especially if you're looking for high protein and low carbs and feeling full afterward. 

i also have a give a positive review for the pork buns and sesame balls, though admittedly, the latter is a bit greasy (but aren't they supposed to be??!?!?). :)
author: isa i.

description:
I meeeeeeeeean. Yeah, this place is totally decent. But here's the thing(s):

1.The servers totally aren't sure what vegan is. Had a very confusing exchange with one of them, the other straight up told me that the sesame mock-chicken was vegan ("because it's made of soy") but didn't take into account the breading and sauce. (I don't think). In general, I wouldn't judge people for this. If you don't know whether or not your  food is vegan, it's fine. However, I'm not going to have as good of an experience.

2. They served me a plate of steamed vegetables and charged me for a full entree. I wanted the mixed vegetable entree, but I wasn't sure whether the sauce was vegan. My inquiries only confused the matter. I thought I was getting mixed veggies with a soy-based sauce, but she brought me a plate of plain steamed veggies and said I could add soy sauce myself. Not very tasty.

3. The mock sesame chicken, which has been raved about, is tasty. However, I feel that those that rave about it haven't experienced a very wide range of mock meats. In terms of fake chicken, it was pretty average. Totally tasty, but in a city like this, nothing to write home about.

I did very much enjoy their large Tsing Taos, and their kind service. When my friend broke one of the large pretty glasses they serve you the beer in, it was not even a thing. Also, notably, the food came out preposterously quickly.

If I'm in the neighborhood, I'll go back here. But they don't have anything to offer that any other reasonable veg-friendly Chinese place in they city doesn't.
author: Devin F.

description: Came here for lunch with friends.  The dim sum combo was decent, but my curry tofu, along with my friend's garlic fish dish, were way too salty.  The service is decent, but I would not return.
author: B. Y.

description:
Do yourself a favor and don't get food delivered from here. I don't really know what happens between leaving the restaurant and arriving at my house, but the results are not tasty. Maybe the driver gets hungry on the way over, eats my order, and then replaces it with Panda Express. Except I'm not sure how that would happen on three separate occasions.

HOWEVER, you would be doing yourself a disservice if you didn't dine in here. Right out of the pan everything is fragrant, delicious, and satisfying. It's a smallish restaurant, but I don't think I've ever had to wait for a table. Service is swift and to-the-point as you would expect of any Chinese restaurant.
author: Amy C.

description:
The amount of alcohol that the Crab Rangoon appetizer has soaked up from my belly is incalculable. Jasmine Tea House, or the Tea Bag as it has been referred to by my friend Mike, is the go-to spot for delivery when I'm too hungover to get off the couch.

Here's why: Prompt, affordable, tasty and the crab puffs I mentioned above are like crack. And who doesn't need a dose of crack when recovering from a night of hedonism?
author: Brittney G.

description:
Meh. 

I've dined here once. The service was good. They kept our waters filled.  I ordered the chicken mu shu. The server made the first wrap for me using 3 spoons. It reminded me of my mom who knew how to do that from working at other people's restaurants.  It was ok. Nothing spectacular. Covered in sauce. ::shrug:::

A got the Wor Wonton soup. The soup weirded both of us out at first because on top is the meat covered with sauce. I've never seen wonton soup like that. A's final verdict was it tastes the same in the end. As everyone who's ever gone to a buffet with a cheap Chinese person (namely me) knows, "eat the meat, it's worth more." The chicken, beef, and bbq pork in the soup was so low quality that when we packed up our leftovers, I dug the wontons and vegetables out of the soup and left the meat behind. Not worth eating.

In short, neither good nor bad. Just meh. And this is so clinched: did I eat at the same place as all the other reviewers?
author: Yan E.

description:
With a picture of Bill Clinton and the owner near the front door, you instantly know you're in the presence of royalty.

The outside of the restaurant is a little tacky, and incongruent with the interior, but that's way cool with me because I totally love this restaurant.  That said, I almost always get the same thing - General Tzao's chicken.

I'll honestly say that I've had good and bad experiences here, but generally I leave incredibly happy because with a lunch price tag of 5.25, the portions and tastiness are impossible to beat.  The real negative part of the general's chicken is that sometimes the chicken comes a little tough, and/or bland.  It sucks, but I simply excuse the issue because I don't cook chicken every time... and I'm a little prejudice because i feel such an affinity toward it.  anyway, it's usually nice and crispy on the outside and the sauce is just tasty sauce.

Also, you get soup with your lunch entrees.  And there is a vegetarian option where vegs can get fake chicken that is pretty damn good.

End of story.  Go to Jasmine Tea House.  It was introduced to me as "supposedly the best chinese in the city"

... maybe it's not.  but there is NO QUESTION that it is the "best chinese at 30th and mission for $5.25 lunch specials."

ps- lunch special till like 4-5pm is pretty notable.
author: Tim P.

description:
So this is a review if you are thinking of having the food delivered......don't do it if you are at all even near being hungry. Weds night at 7:45 we ordered the food...it is now 9:15 and nothing yet!!! I just called them and it seems like no one knows where the delivery guy is....spoke with two people who weren't sure if he was on his way....I am ready to eat my arm....and just want to cancel the darn order...but am too hungry!!! So decided to yelp about it. Consider yourself warned.....you may die from starvation if you ask them to deliver. 

Ok, update. The food came at 9:30. The delivery guy said there was a fire and mission st was closed....you couldn't have called and said you can't deliver the food? Here is where it gets worse...the food sucked and our order was wrong. Waited this long and the food sucks and order is wrong??? My husband didn't take more than one bite of his spareribs "this is gross" is his review...and my ginger chicken was disgusting too...and thanks for the steamed rice that we ordered that came as fried rice...and not even tasty fried rice but gross fried rice. We are now heating up left-over pizza....sorry, Jasmine Tea House, that's too many strikes. Never again.
author: Mojgan J.

description: I love their food! but their owner/manager is a piece of shit and a lier. he told me my order did not go through and they had no idea what I was talking about. After! two different women told me my order was on its way to my house and repeated back my order. Their customer service really sucks and they need improvement. For having such good food their service sucks and i will not be returning.
author: Celina G.

description:
I am completely awestruck by the positive reviews for this place.  I ordered (take-out) General Tsao's Chicken, Szechuan Beef, and House Spicy Chow Fun, and every single dish was borderline disgusting.  It also made me physically ill.  The noodles were okay, I guess, if congealed and dripping with oil.  But the General Tsao's and Szechuan Beef were virtually identical as far as I could tell -- deep fried to all hell, soaked in a vat of corn starch, syrup, and MSG, and then sprinkled with two slightly different flavor dusts.  They were virtually inedible.  I threw it all out.  

I mean, I realize we're in the Mission and there's no actual Chinese food here, but this was just gross -- like a good 117 steps below Panda Express.  How anyone could give this place four or five stars is totally beyond me -- have y'all been suffering lifetime imprisonment in leg irons with nothing to eat but stale gruel?
author: Bill S.

description:
Went with 9 friends and family for dinner on my birthday 8/21. The food was a little slower coming out than usual, it's usually lightning fast, but everything was very good. I tried the fancy crab dish pictured on their website for the 1st time and it was a big hit with everyone!
Everyone loved dinner, they have brown rice for the health conscious and the hot and sour soup does not have pork so everyone at the table enjoyed it. The onion pancakes and veggie pot stickers were also a hit. And the total bill was very affordable.
author: lia k.

description:
It pains me to do this, but Jasmine Tea House has been a naughty naughty bitch the last three times I've ordered from them. Let's recap, shall we?

1. JTH took an astonishing 90 minutes to deliver my food. Mind you, I'm about a mile away from the restaurant and I was calling on a weekday evening. I got the runaround when I called to ask the location of my order, and when it finally showed up, the food was tepid at best.

2. They forgot my rice and charged me for it. Don't get it twisted, I'm sure I'll find some way of absorbing the $1.50 loss into my budget, but it's the principle! They conveniently forgot to give me a free rice on my next order. 

3. Last but certainly not least was the final delivery where JTH was apparently doing a rather successful impression of Panda Express. The food was incredibly salty, my bf's Mongolian Beef should have been called Mongolian Leather, and the steamed rice was crispy at the top and bottom. I hate that!. This is clearly a sign that someone was not minding the rice cooker.

Jasmine Tea House and I are on a break. I'm seeing someone new by the name of Big Lantern and I have to say things are looking promising.
author: C P.

description:
I ordered from Jasmine as a backup because the place I was going to order from China Wok on Monterey Blvd (who has good food) exhibited poor service this last time. Wok's hours say til 1AM on their website, but they called and said they close at 10PM (it was 9:30PM when I placed online order, and 9:50 when the place called to tell me they couldn't deliver my order because the kitchen was closed). So on to Jasmine I found thru a Yelp review when searching for late Chinese delivery to  Bernal. 

Well, when I called to order it was 9:55pm and asked if they would still deliver. The guy asked where I lived, and he cheerfully said "yes" they would deliver and it would be the driver's last stop. He only asked that I tip the driver in cash (I was paying by card) since the driver would be going home after our stop. Fair enough. 

The food that came was HOT, and fresh. Sesame Beef was crispy and savory, not greasy. Spicy eggplant chicken was nice, not over-sauced, but with flavorful eggplant and crisp stir fried zucchini and veggies. The free bbq pork chow mein (free rice or chow mein with 2 entree orders) was good aldente  with nice portion of bbq pork. Hot and sour soup was hearty but slightly under seasoned; I'd prefer some with a peppery kick. 

Jasmine was certainly better and fresher tasting than some of the other mediocre places in the Bernal area. (Not a fan of Hunan Chef, they have live finches in cages in the dining room....seems a little against any health code).

They score on the customer service side, not declining business because it's 5 minutes before closing.
author: Jon L.

description: In spite of many positive reviews and recommendations, we're done with this place. Two meals (both via delivery) were wan and flavorless. Mushu Pork was ok but let's be real: I need more than one decent dish to make me come back.
author: steve m.

description: The meatless chicken dishes are amazing! You can get any of the meat dishes made with meatless chicken! mmmmm General Tso!! I highly recommend them! They are one of my favorite places to eat in the Mission.
author: Maude S.

description:
Jasmine is reminiscent of the chinese food place I ordered from multiple times a week in highschool.  As the only vegetarian in my texan family, I did what I could in the midst of the regular features at my house-  chicken fried steak, beef stroganoff, and spaghetti with meatballs.  

in other words, I would feel comfy moving to bernal heights just knowing that this delish and hearty, well priced chinese food was at my beckon call, taking me back to days past.

the veggie potstickers, are gingery and flavorful- no soggy cabbage here. and the faux sesame chicken was delectable. also, its a no frills place, I can wear my awkward outfit and no makeup and feel right at home. I love places like this. so neighborhoody and trend-free. like chicken noodle soup. mmmm.
author: Liz S.

description:
Totally worth the short walk from my house, but something Ca-razy happens when these folks deliver. Every aspect of the food goes down a notch or maybe even three. I seriously did not want to touch the stuff.

In any case, $15 bottles of wine, fun, make sure you order the right shit, stress free environment for vegetarians (that's one hell of a buddha's delight), dumplings (a childhood memory come true). I like their duck, except it's so fatty it often makes me sick. I guess the fact that I still eat it anyway, attests to it's deliciousness.

Most of all though, this place is cozy with wonderful service and it is highly convenient. I would go more often if I could.
author: Alexandra M.

description:
Very kind staff here and one of the best combo delivery deals around. For $10 you get soup, eggroll, an entree and rice. It's called, fittingly, "I Don't Want To Cook".

There is something about the housemade fake meat here. I was briefly addicted to it. I'm not even a Veganarian, but I found myself with the oddest cravings for their meatless Kung Pao. Then one day, poof, I was immune, nothing. It got under my skin though, quite inexplicably, so I'd be remiss not to bring this up.
.
But I'm still giving this place the Trinity. Fast to your door Mission. There are far worse Chinese comestibles en El Barrio. That and Clinton ate here twice. He also ordered to go, and because he was Bill MFing Clinton Jasmine Tea House cooked him up some vittles even even though they'd closed the kitchen. So while I don't order from JTH anymore (Wild Pepper, you had me at the free Chow Mein) when I did, it made eating chinese take-out on my couch with sporks seem somehow...Clintonian.
author: Jeremy W.

description:
Being that there are so many regulars to the place tells you that they must be doing something right.  It's quite apparent.  The food and service were amazing.  And Jasmine provides the most friendly and welcoming environment that I've ever experienced at a Chinese restaurant.  But not only were the staff kind.  A customer on his way out, also veg, overheard me asking about vegetarian offerings and was kind enough to point out a few choice selections, as well as emphasizing that almost anything can be made vegetarian.  Having such thoughtful patrons is just an extension of the type of hospitality you can expect at this restaurant.

If that wasn't enough, the fact that they offer faux meat to non-meat eaters, like myself, makes it all the better.  And listen to laura b.; the veg style sesame chicken is the best!

I've just scratched the surface of the menu.  I'll definitely be back. I just wished I lived by here.  What a great place to get delivery.
author: Marsha Z.

description:
Addicted To:

Basil Ostrich
Mandarin Lamb

Avoid: 
Korean Chicken 

I am glad they deliver :)
author: MJ C.

description:
I got exactly what I wanted here.

I had a half hour before meeting my friend, and I wanted soup. In the outer mission, an area laden with taquerias, I wasn't sure where to look. I certainly wasn't going to go to Lotus Garden (see review) so I popped in here.

I ordered the combination wonton soup. After a pretty short wait, I received a giant steaming bowl of soup packed with perfectly cooked prawns, pork, wontons, and veggies. The soup was great, and the bowl was just $7.50. Perfectly acceptable for the huge portion.

The staff here was so friendly, and they were accomodating without breathing down your neck. Nice quiet atmosphere, and I was in and out in a half hour. Not bad for a lovely bowl of soup with friendly waiters.

I would definitely keep this place in mind for my go to soup in the outer mission! Also, there was a group of four people next to me sharing all kinds of dishes, and they seemed very happy with their food. I would definitely come back to try out some more dishes.
author: Audrey K.

description:
Ahhhh.

This is what good clean chinese food is about. 

Jasmine Tea House is located on the
14, 49, 26 bus lines. 

The staff are very friendly and accommodating.

The bathroom is clean and the restaurant is super clean. Good sign.

I normally don't order from this restaurant for delivery, since it doesn't taste the same. The food you order must be eaten at the restaurant.

Brad and I walked into the restaurant and were
immediately led to a nice quaint table. We were provided ice water and menus immediately upon sitting down.

We ordered the following:
Potstickers
Crab meat cheese wontons
Honey Walnut Prawns
Wor Won ton soup

Once you order your appetizer, they immediately place a cute tray of sweet and sour sauce, hot mustard, soy sauce for dipping. 

And that's when happiness began.

The crab meat cheese puffs are 6 lightly fried triangles of won tons filled with imitation crab meat, green onion, spices and cream cheese. It's lightly crispy on the outside and tender on the inside.
It's extremely tasty when dipped in the hot mustard. It was fresh and wonderful.

The potstickers arrived next...and these potstickers put Superstar yong de to shame. Superstar yong de, you need to take your soggy potstickers and take lessons from Jasmine Tea House.

Jasmine Tea House prepared 6 perfect potstickers. They are lightly crisp on the bottom, and soft and tender all around. Once you bite into them, the flavors and juiciness of the potsticker will explode in your mouth. They were so good, that Brad and I had to fight for the last one....I lost. Boo hoo.

His Honey Walnut prawns arrived. Now these were huge delicately fried prawns (not shrimp) in batter, coated with a creamy sweet white sauce and tossed with Candied Walnuts. It was crispy, light, sweet and delicious. Think of a different version of sweet and sour prawns...with a white sauce. He was quiet the whole time, so I know he enjoyed his entree.

My Wor won ton soup arrived...and this to me was the piece de resistance. This is what won ton soup is about. This puts all won ton soup to shame.  All other won ton soups I eat in other chinese restaurants tastes like flavorless warm water with soggy won tons floating in it...yuck.

This soup is perfect..why you ask
1. 8 perfectly cooked won tons floating in a wonderfully spiced and flavorful rich dark broth. The vegetables of mushrooms, greens add to the flavor, the bbq pork, chicken and beef sat atop of the dish like a crown jewel engulfed in a thick rich brown sauce to add this delicious explosion of heaven in your mouth. The bowl was beautiful and the temp of the broth is how soup should be...steaming hot! WOW. 

And folks, this is why this soup would be my last meal on earth. It's absolute heaven. And this restaurant created this wonderful concoction. So next time you go to this restaurant, sit down and enjoy their won ton soup. No soup will ever taste that good.
author: Charlene C.

description:
-- THE BEST (fake) General Tso's chicken ever (ever) by far our favorite Chinese take out.  

A friend took me here to prove or disprove that they had the best fake chicken in town and it was no contest, we had it in the form a great rendition of General Tso's chicken (not really Chinese I KNOW) but soooo good, also pea sprouts in garlic and wine, so good!

 its not on the menu but they can make almost any dish with their home made fake meat sub, you just have to ask
author: Jared Z.

description:
I've had their hot and sour soup, moo shu vegetables, chow mien, fried rice, kung pao meatless chicken(the best I've had in this city)...

Everything tastes great, fresh and best of all...free! since I steal platefuls of food from my sister and her boyfriend who order delivery from this place!
author: Caroline C.

description:
This is clean restaurant and the service is fast and friendly.  

I recommend the combination won-ton soup and the vegetable salad (sans tomato). 

I want to come back and try a different entree because the Mongolian Beef wasn't that good (maybe I am just sick of Mongolian Beef now?).  However, everything else I had, including the tea, was great!
author: Roxanne B.

description:
My GF and I had lunch at Jasmine Tea House over the weekend. We had only two dishes, but both were very good. Despite this restaurant being in my neighborhood, I had never eaten there (and I'd heard it was good). I don't know what took me so long, it's the best Chinese food around these parts. 

We had wonton soup that had lots of meat, pork and prawns in it, very yummy and a 1/2 Peking duck with buns that was very good too. 

This place does not have the best Chinese food I've ever had, but it was quite good and it's the best in Bernal Heights I've had. Much better than Nulite Kitchen up the street.
author: Yvette K.

description:
The best Chinese food I've had in a LOOOOOOOONG time.  I ordered the some of their "Chef's Specials" for dinner including:
Oolong Duck, Jasmine prawn, and Mandarin Combo clay pot.

Duck: Real tender and juicy with a NICE smokey tea flavor infused.  It was a little salty but that was a small price to pay considering how good it was.

Prawns: Shrimp was juicy and tender with a fantastic sauce they use.  Comes with woodear mushrooms, that I must say are actually pretty good (I'm not too fond of any other mushrooms except for "buttons")

Clay pot:  Better of all the three dishes.  Combo of shrimp, scallops, chicken, pork, and beef sauteed in an excellent sauce that made my day worthwhile (I had a bad day at work).


Food was real simple and delicious.  They use fresh ingredients and they give you heaping portions.  Try it, you'll love it!
author: Chai S.

description:
I order take out from here maybe once a month for work. 

Bill Clinton ate here...once...according to their website where I printed off their menu. Whooooooo Hooooooo!! It MUST be good then. That fatboy loved to eat. I had no idea he was a big fan of the mu shu. 

Anyhoo, these fools are FAST throwing everything together and delivering within the time they say they will. That's all you need to know. 

And as far as food goes...the Mongolian Beef rocks my world. They serve a brown rice option too.
author: Matthew M.

description:
My favorite Chinese Food place of all time. Everything here is cooked perfectly, from the Sunflower Chicken to the Fried Rice to the Ostrich. The desserts are wonderful. The tea selection is surprisingly limited for a place with a name like this, but who really needs that.

This is not a greasy spoon like you find in Chinatown. It definitely has a western influence, as there are some vegetarian alternatives that are more Berkeley than Beijing, but every time I've eaten here I've gone home very, very satisfied. 

I love this place. I can't recommend it enough.
author: Eric M.

description:
After years of trying every nasty Chinese delivery joint that hung a flyer on my doorknob, I can finally stop the search! Jasmine Tea House is by far the best Chinese delivery in San Francisco based on my vast expertise. My veggie friends love the meatless chicken! I love the sunflower chicken and the prawns with lobster sauce are ridonkulous! 

One complaint - I love walnut prawns but theirs are waaaay too mayonaisey. Go light on the mayo!

It's still Chinese take-out, so it's no fresh food fiesta or anything, but it's top notch take-out!
author: Nissa A.

description:
My vegetarian friends LOVE the Meatless Chicken dish.   I think it is called the Happy Buddha.

I love and have never been disappointed by:
Pork Siu Mai
Pork Pot Stickers
Deep Fried Oysters
Szechwan Beef
ANY fried rice
I have had a few of the Eggplant dishes and loved them.   Forget which though.   :)

The only thing I have been disappointed with has been the Seafood Chow Fun.   It is very tasty and has some great seafood in it but is very soupy.

Free delivery is available for lunch and dinner within the delivery area. Order 2 entrees and get free fried rice or chow mein (a choice of pork, chicken, beef or vegetable). $10 Minimum for credit card orders.

Say Hi to Frank for me!
author: Jack C.

description:
REALLY GOOD AND QUICK CHINESE DELIVERY for Bernal/Mission/Noe.  I got the Happy Buddha' which is one of the specials- had meatless chicken (made from wheat gluten, this is one of the best meat substitutes I've had) along with really good veggies like mushroom caps, broccoli, snow peas, carrots in a subtle, herbal brown sauce.

Food came hot, which was nice.  My friend's kung pao tofu tasted ok, although I don't normally love kung pao.

Plus, with 2+ entrees they give you free fried rice or lo mein (choice of meat/veggie).  I got the veggie lo mein- this was really good as the noodles weren't too fried.  I didn't love the veg selection in the veg lo mein, but it was free so I'm not going to complain!
author: Jeff A.

description:
My husband was a big fan of this place back in the day when he lived in Bernal, and now that we ware back in the city and within delivery distance he is a happy man once again.

I am a big fan of the lemon chicken, and Mister B loooooves the Oolong duck (it is actually almost better the next day, still cold).   I think you can't go wrong with anything from their Chef's Special list.  

An uber-cool thing about this place is that if you order 2 entrees you get free fried rice or chow mein.
author: Aimee B.

description:
This is my 2nd favorite place to eat in San Fransisco.

Every dish I have tried is very well prepared.  Usually after leaving a chinese restaurant i feel bloated like i just drank a bucket of grease, this place never gives me that feeling.

The dim sum to order is....just amazing.  They carry exactly what I like and the service is fast.

Aside from the food, the best part about this place is the staff.  they are so friendly, helpful, and smiley.  you can strike a conversation with them while waiting for take out and they are funny, good natured and just pleasant to deal with.

The best place to park is burger king across the street and north about half a block.  I never get towed.

-R
author: Ross P.

description:
When talking about dinner, our conversations usually go something like this:

Adam: Anything in particular you'd like for dinner?
Carla: I don't know... anything you'd like?
Adam: Nah, I'm flexible.
Carla: Well, so am I. Just let me know.
Adam: Nothing sounds good? 
Carla: I'm fine with whatever you want. 
Adam: Please make a decision.
Carla: OK, how about Serrano's, JTH, or Guadalajara?
Adam: Please pick one.
Carla: ::silence:: JTH.

Basically, I used the all-too-familiar dialogue to illustrate that JTH has become a part of our routine. Adam doesn't even need to ask me what I want, he knows that I'm devoted to the vegetable pot stickers (perfection), green onion cake (fried bits of gospel), and General's chicken (rarely breaded, always amazing). We got wild the last time and ordered the five spice chicken, which was great as well. 

I'll also leave you with the image of us eating JTH out of the to-go containers with one fork and a carved decorative African spoon, standing up in the kitchen the first night in Adam's new apartment. It's that good.
author: Carla C.

description:
I really like the General Tso's chicken, though sometimes they only batter half the pieces.  The meatless chicken, made with soy and and wheat gluten is really tasty and moist.  

The egg rolls and fried rice are also really good.  I will stay away from the beef, as it was super chewy and inedible for me.  

There are always tons of cops eating here at dinner.  I've noticed that they can order lunch specials anytime they like.
author: Amy D.

description:
I'm a big fan of monkey-picked products.  I buy only monkey-picked stocks, for example.  And look how well we're doing with our monkey-picked President.  Well, maybe not that one.  

Meanwhile, I was quite impressed with the way Jasmine Tea House handled a dinner for 30 of my dearest colleagues this week.  Things got off to a bit of a slow start, when the server laid down a plate of 3 tiny spring rolls, each cut in half, at our table of ten famished tech workers.  But they picked up speed through the rest of the appetizers and soup course and when they hit the main dishes, it was like a wall of food coming at us.  

Some really succulent platters landed, and several of us raved about the basil chicken and the lamb.  I differ from Monkey S (is she the same monkey?...no, couldn't be) on the pot-stickers--I like Eliza's better--but I'll be back.  Definitely check them out if you need a reasonably priced place to take a big crowd.
author: Kevin S.

description:
Jasmine Tea House hits the spot when you're hungry!  When I first started dating the now-new-husband, he swore the General Tsao chicken was the best he's ever had, and I gotta admit, I do love it; the chicken, the rice and the broccoli was cooked just right.  I make it a point to at least try different meals every time I go, but I always go back to the General chicken.  Heck, even the fake chicken tastes good!

The service is fast and quick, and they prices are incredibly decent, especially the lunch specials.  The wait staff are totally nice, and they remember you if you're a repeat customer.  Definitely a great place.
author: Eidelyn G.

description:
I ordered kung pao tofu and veggie egg rolls with moderate standards and, after waiting over a fucking hour for my delivery (which was also placed at 5:00pm, therefore early as fuck, i.e. pre-dinner rush), was disappointed. I mean, c'mon! It's hard to disappoint me, I eat dirty paper towels and sticks by choice! I think garbage tastes good! And yet the food here-- again, already ordered with blah-level standards-- totally pissed me off. I was all like, "hey, kung pao tofu--do you think it's funny to suck so bad? Really, is this a game to you?" And then I punched it in the face.  Christ, I won't even get into what I did to the egg rolls. That was some seriously brutal shit.

Yeah, I'm tuff. I'm sure you're all recognizing right now, so I'll take a second to let you finish. You know, recognizing. My tuffness. Ahem.

Okay, maybe I ordered the "wrong" thing (god, I'm such a douche for using quotes), but really. Did it have to be that bad? Really?

I will, however, admit that had the food arrived in, say, 30 minutes as opposed to 60+, I'd given J.T.H. 2 or 3 stars. What can I say, I get cranky when I'm hungry.
author: Chloe S.

description: Great place to eat at or have delivered. The combination won ton soup!
author: Veronica G.

description: The greatest wonton soup ever.  Except in China.  Maybe.  I've never been there.  I don't even know if they eat wonton soup in China.  So, let's just safely say this is the greatest wonton soup in Bernal Heights.
author: Laurence W.

description:
So my friend has this habit of ordering in Chinese food? And both places in the past has made her deathly ill or just plain grossed out. 

Jasmine Tea House .. didn't. Yay!

Chicken corn soup was pretty good. Then again, I like anything with egg drop.

I had the chow mein and beef. While their food claims to lack MSG, there was something in the beef that makes it kinda ... funky. No complaints. I'd say the food is pretty good. I'm just picky b/c the best Chinese food comes from my mommy!
author: Emily C.

description:
C'mon, we all like Americanized Chinese food sometimes...

I just moved to the neighborhood and have been on the lookout for my go to neighborhood Chinese restaurant. Thanks to Jasmine Tea, my search is over!

Delivery: they came within 40-50 minutes as promised. Only catch is that they don't automatically provide rice with the order (how weird is that?). After we realized this, they quickly reappeared. 

Dining In: has a homey feel. The owners and staff have their own dining area that is separated with a partition, and there are sounds of Cantonese mixed with other dialects coming from the kitchen. The service was friendly and prompt. We were the last table of the night and didn't feel rushed at all. My boyfriend actually forgot his credit card, and when we called the next day, they were very friendly and understanding. 

Favorite dishes: chow fun, Chinese broccoli. I also like to order off the menu (like at most Chinese restaurants, they accommodate everything). Their menu seems sparse,  but they have it all... not to mention rave reviews from President Clinton. 

I would give Jasmine Tea 5 stars, but rice doesn't automatically come with the entrees! It's still my favorite Chinese restaurant in SF so far.
author: kathy c.

description:
I'm eating vegetarian food this month after reading the reviews praising the fakechickenproduct I was excited to try it out. Last night my girlfriend and I ordered the two fakechickenproduct dishes on the menu, the sweet & sour and the kung pao. The delivery was quick and the portions were generous. The flavor however was only okay. I enjoyed the fakechickenproduct but my sweet and sour was boring. The kung pao was a little more exciting but nothing I could get too excited about. A lot of the most positive reviews mention the sesame fakechickenproduct and either it's not on the menu anymore or it's a secret unlisted item.

I want to try them again, perhaps in the restaurant, when I'm eating meat again. Particularly I'm excited to try their Basil Ostrich and their Dry Sauted Frogs Legs.
author: Ian M.

description:
The Place: Small, Clean, Casual
The Service: Friendly, Inviting 
The Food: Great Variety, Flavorful

Must Haves: Sizzling Rice Soup, General Tsao's Chicken, Walnut Prawns

Pass on the Steamed BBQ Pork Buns.
author: Justin P.

description:
This has to be the worst Chinese ever! I ordered Sweet and Sour Pork... what I got was some dried up BBQ pork slices that had sweet and sour sauce poured over it! I will NEVER order from this place again and would not recommend it to my worst enemy.
DO NOT ORDER FROM HERE
author: Corey B.

description:
Sometimes an actor will comment on the supreme virtuosity of a director by saying something like "I would act in his movie if he directed the phone book." I feel the same way about Jasmine Tea House, only I would eat their breaded and fried phone book.

Tonight we gave JTH the "car test" where we ordered two dishes of fake chicken to go, got stuck in traffic, and killed time waiting to get on the Bay Bridge by eating, sans utensils, the Kung Pao Meatless Chicken and the Sweet Sour Meatless Chicken. Even though both dishes had cooled off and were messy to eat, they were still delicious. The Kung Pao chicken is like a bonbon but made out of a fried shell with a soft fake chicken center instead of chocolate. This dish is THE definition of the word "delectable."

As always: a more decadent San Francisco alternative to Oakland's Great Wall (http://www.yelp.com/biz/8BUlhygOXr26Wfry7j1w7g). I have to admit: JTHs fake chicken is probably the best in the entire world.
author: Ross G.

description:
YUM. After reading reviews, I ordered form here. I do love Eric's, didn't think this was better, but very good for delivery. Best so far. Great Sesame Beef, good app combo plate. Love the freebie w/ 2 entrees. Will definately keep ordering. Have passed the name on to others.
Just tried the Ooling Duck, soooo good! The dim sum app combo is also very good.
author: C B.

description:
I've eaten in twice and had delivery once. The delivered food was very 
blah. The two times I have dined in the restaurant I was very happy. The
service was outstanding and the place is clean and well kept. I had the
Chicken Chow Fun yesterday at lunch and it was WON DER FUL! I won't do the delivery again but I will return and eat in. The 4 stars are for
dining in. 2 stars for delivery.
author: Cindy J.

description: *4 stars* for their beef stew wonton noodle soup
author: Kae B.

description: I went there with my family today & when I stepped in, it was so quiet! It's very hard to find chinese places that is very quiet now a days. The owner picked our food for us & it was great! Not salty at all! Not like other chinese places. Service was great. Wait was kind of long because it was packed. Will visit next time to try out other dishes and write another review about this place.
author: Jenny H.

description:
I can't understand all the fuss about this place. Our food was the usual westernized chinese crispy-stuff-in-grease. 

Sweet and sour fake chicken and Kung Pao fake chicken.  We kept some of the sweet and sour sauce for use in a power outage, it's so glow-in-the-dark fake. Actually it may be radioactive.

The delivery was free and quick on a Sunday night, but they forgot half our order. I wasn't too disappointed tho', because they stuff they bought was very unpleasant.
author: bristol b.

description: Okay, so it pains me to give a four stars to my favorite neighborhood Chinese restaurant, but it's my favorite because of certain dishes (not all dishes are created equal).  My favorites: the vegetable pot stickers can't be beat, so tasty!  And the Kung Pao Meatless Chicken is to die for; peanuts and sauce and fake meat, oh my!  Be sure to get the monkey picked tea; it's more than just a fun name, it's a way of life.  Also, don't miss out on the cinnamint candies at the door (shh, don't tell, I always take more than my fair share!)  Yum, yum and more yum!
author: Cassidy P.

description:
Note: I've only ever ordered delivery.

From the menu this place has great potential - all the Chinese takeout standards plus novelties like Basil Ostrich and Happy Buddha (fake meat).  But the reality was just more of the same old mushy, bland chinese food that you can get anywhere.

It wasn't even good straight out of the fridge after a mission bar crawl - which says a LOT!  And it gave  me a crazy case of the burps.
author: Tessa M.

description: This place is a neighborhood favorite of mine, and is a great spot to go to with an old friend or for a family meal.  All of my experiences here have been good, and I love how at home they make you feel.
