description: what made me think this would be okay? was I really too tired to cook? when the only really edible thing is the steamed rice and only because I can save it to make fried later is it really worth it...very sad and still hungry
author: holly B.

description: I'm the kind of gal who likes pu pu platters and appetizers and not the really spicy stuff.  I love a place with a nice combo plate.  I just polished off the leftovers from what I ordered last night: combination plate (rangoon, egg rolls, wontons, chicken wings, those potato-chippy things), vegetable fried rice (big chunks of veggies like broccoli, carrots and squash in it!) and walnut prawns.  It hit the spot, both last night and today.  Finally, a place that delivers to my 'hood that has decent grub!
author: Bodacious T.

description: Service is good, but parking is a challenge.  Typical Chinese food place in my book.  Nothing special.
author: Richard F.

description: I"ve never dined here, but they are great delivery and everything I've had is really good. To top it all off with the purchase of two entrees you get free chowmein or fried rice. This is my favorite Chinese place.
author: JIll H.

description: I was really excited to visit this place after reading the other yelper reviews.  The place had nice ambiance, great service and decent prices but I wasn't very impressed with the food. I ordered the garlic chicken and it was pretty bland.  Not much flavor, not much spice and fatty chicken.  My friend ordered the ostrich which he really enjoyed.  I think it could be one of those "maybe I just didn't get the right dish" thing.  Not sure but I probably won't go back.
author: karla k.

description:
(This food was delivered, so I'm not sure what it's like in the restaurant).

In general, the food wasn't that great.  We had siu mai (horrible, even worse than what I would have expected from take-out), bbq pork ribs (barely edible), ginger chicken (edible), sizzling beef (it was alright, kind of tasted like the ginger chicken) and combination fried rice.

The price was fair ($35 including generous tip because I felt bad for the gas he probably has to spend driving around town) but the delivery time was over an hour.

If you're in a bind, I guess it's not horrible to order from here, but it's really not some place I wlll ever go again.
author: Stan L.

description: Not the worst but not great. Got my very simple order wrong (Egg Rolls instead of Shrimp Balls). Served crappy Hot and Sour Soup. No Soy Sauce provided. Chicken was mostly fat and gristle and I had to throw it out. Singapore Noodle was ordered without Pork... and came with pork. I don't think we'll order from here again. Shame, their menu is so nice. Also expensive for what you get.
author: Alex D.

description: I ordered a HUGE delivery for about 25 people at my company and it was an overall success. They delivered on time, gave me a 15% discount on my whole order, and gave us plenty of food! I got a lot of comments from coworkers that the food was the bomb (both Asian and non-Asian coworkers). Being Chinese myself, I was skeptical since the reviews were pretty mixed, but I have to say that the food was still very decent for "American" style Chinese food. We got a mix of dim sum (basic ha gao, shu mai, bbq pork bun, and chives dumping), sweet sour meatless chicken, westlake fish, beef/broccoli, green beans and stuff like chow mein and a mix of brown/white rice. All of it was really tasty - even the veggy stuff! We spent about $240 to feed way over 25 people so it was well worth it.
author: dobi d.

description: I must thank Michael G. for specifically pointing this joint out to me... I think Jasmine might be the local Chinese place I've been searching for.  I've been sick this week, and I always have wonton soup when I'm sick.  (Why?  Because I'm generally too wimpy for tom yum soup.)  I got takeout from Jasmine, and I was pleasantly surprised.  the broth was rich and flavorful, with good chunks of meat and lots of wontons.  And while I'm still sick (clearly have not had enough soup), I feel like I could eat this all week.  Faboo.
author: Nat K.

description: Considering that there's a dearth of good Chinese places that will deliver to my house, I was pleased to find this place.  I have to agree with the other reviewers -- the veggie chicken is the best thing to get.  Everything else is just OK...  which sometimes will do just fine for dinner.
author: Andi T.

description: I have been ordering from this place since it was Royal Kitchen back in the early '90s. Consistently great quality, low prices, quick delivery, and the restaurant itself is a excellent option for a nice night out without breaking the bank. It beats out most of the new school restaurants popping up in that 'hood, and is friendlier and cheaper! Favorites include General Cho's Chicken, Pork Potstickers (awesome sauces) and the Chicken Corn Chowder soup.
author: Jimmy D.

description: I like Jasmine Tea House mostly because it's the best Chinese place that delivers to my house. The food's good too, of course, if a bit Californianized/yuppiefied -- apparently President Clinton ordered from here when he was in SF. They have brown rice, which can be hard to find, and their General Tso's chicken is much less fried than other places'. A bit pricey, but it can be worth it.
author: Tara M.

description: This place is great!  I've eaten here and have also had food delivered to my house.  It's always been delicious and consistent.  The General Tsao Chicken, Fried Rice, Mongolian Beef and almost anything else you have is going to be tasty! The restaurant  is small and clean and the service is great!  The lunch specials are great and the prices are even better!  This is definitely my go to place for Chinese food any time I am craving Chinese.
author: d p.

description: Great deal on dinner combo B:  2 Eggrolls, Hot and Sour Soup, rice and garlic shrimp for $12.
author: Shannon B.

description: I seriously love Chinese food like no other, and Jasmine Tea House is arguably the best I have everrrrrr gotten. The walnut shrimp was so fucking good I almost had to change my pants. The soups, pork buns, vegetable stir-fry, and chow mein are also excellent, which is a testament to their range in dishes. My group of 4 ate heartily amongst two appetizers, three main dishes and tea for about $45, which is a complete deal.
author: Jenz y.

description: Funky spacing.  But the food and prices are great!  The service is a bit odd, though.
author: Nathan W.

description: I absolutely love this place.  Its subtle exterior definitely does not do it justice.  One might easily pass by on Mission Street and never notice what lies behind the doors.  Inside, you will find an ambiance that is simple and understated.  Its the food and the service that I really can't say enough about here.  The great thing is that dim sum is available throughout the day, you can even have it at night.  The chow fun is very tasty.  The sizzling rice soup is very flavorful.  I really love the dim sum here and the shanghai dumplings are great.   I always feel like I get great service here and since I come here often, I am familiarly greeted which is nice.  A big thumbs up here!
author: Candice M.

description: I used to get my Chinese from Eric's on Church but they've been letting me down. My aunt suggested Jasmine's and its my new go to Chinese spot. the food is so good, it can get tads pricey, but i just need it sometimes. Its not greasy either, and with Chinese food that can be a rare find.
author: Bobby P.

description:
I'm bummed. Someone please tell me that Tuesdays are their chef's night off and to go on Fridays instead.

This place used to be so good. I'd always clean the plate. My friend and I went and we only ate about half.  The eggplant seemed undercooked and we had to send it back for more wok time.  Even when it came back I felt like the sauce was this generic brown sauce.  And there were hardly any mushrooms despite it being the portabella mushroom eggplant.  The Buddist veggies with fake chicken did not excite my taste buds either.

What happened?  

one little clue.  I could swear their menu used to say that you could get fake chicken with any chicken dish, but that note seems to be gone.
author: Charles B.

description: I was so glad Jasmine Tea House reopened but was disappointed with the food. Ordered delivery the othe night and it was definitely not as tasty as before. Maybe they are just getting back into the groove or maybe my memory was much sweeter than the actual food! Anyway, we are going to continue ordering from Shiso (the place we turned to when Jasmine closed).
author: Anna F.

description: It's been hit or miss here and there but for the most part I have usually been satisfied. I like to order the lunch special on a rainy netflix afternoon. I say go with the vegi potstickers. Wonderful-not too "doughy" not too chewy. Always just right and full of fresh veggies.
author: Kia B.

description: Perfect for delivery. It's the only experience I've had with this place...never dined in. Order 2 dishes and fried rice or chow mein is free!  Definitely the best chinese delivery place yet but expect about 40 min wait cause they're popular!
author: Tanger T.

description: Yummy food served with good cheer in pleasant surroundings -- exactly what I'm looking for in a neighborhood restaurant of any kind. My sweetie and I ordered our two "spicy" dishes prepared "medium spicy" and found them merely very tasty; next time we'll order them "spicy" and see what we get. The Mongolian Beef and the Garlic Chicken were both delicious -- I look forward to sampling more of the menu.
author: Rose W.

description: I used to love this place, but from my recent takeout experiences, the magic has gone from this place. Just like the Clinton administration.
author: Rene D.

description: I think Jasmine Tea House has good food, service, and atmosphere. The people there are really nice and really listen to your order! I am a regular there and I pretty much order the same thing every time, and they memorize our order down to the kind of beer my dad likes! I also think the food is pretty good, so I'd give them a three and a half or four...
author: Lily B.

description: I want to like Jasmine Tea House more than I do, but I just find the food pretty average. My friend looooooves this place and eats there several times a week. Me? I think it's kinda meh. Granted, they have a good selection of vegetarian choices, the tofu-chicken is darn tasty, and the folks who run this establishment are mighty friendly. Also, it must be mentioned that they do indeed deliver to a wide radius. I just wish the food was more scrumptious, memorable, rich, flavorful, and noteworthy. It's not.
author: Melinda K.

description: I went to dinner with my husband at Jasmine Tea House for the first time the other night. We each ordered a dish and shared a third. My shrimp with portabello mushrooms was a tasty mix of vegetables and shrimp with just a hint of garlic. Our shared mixed seafood entree was not bad, if a little uninteresting. My husband found his pork stir-fry to be overly sweet. While I appreciated that the dishes were lighter than most Chinese places, they seemed to make up for this by throwing in all the more MSG. I'd recommend drinking a lot of water or avoiding this place all together if you're particularly MSG-sensitive. I can handle some MSG, but the food isn't really good enough to warrant many return trips and future MSG headaches. Parking is a little tricky, but not bad compared to a lot of other neighborhoods in the city.
author: Megan K.

description: Jasmine Tea House has the best chinese food in the city as far as I'm concerned. Their Dry Fried Prawns are absolutely fabulous. I've never had anything like them. Their Wor Wonton Soup is amazing, full of shrimp, pork, beef and fresh bok choy and black mushrooms. They use really good ingredients so you don't get any knuckly pieces or fat in the meat dishes. Plus they give you a free order of chow mein when you order 2 entreees. Very friendly staff and quick service for phone orders.
author: Armand C.

description: Guess what? Due to a noodle emergency the other night (as in I needed some chow fun STAT), we found out JTH makes very authentic, Hong Kong-style noodles here. Hurray!! Now I don't have to go all the way to Chinatown just to get me some delicious beef chow fun or pan-fried noodles Hong Kong style.
author: Angi C.

description: This place is lame.  I called on a Saturday night and got a busy signal for 15 minutes.  Or maybe that means they're that good.
author: Eric J.

description: I've had better....this place is not the same for me anymore.  I do love chinese food and use to come here but then it got new owners.  I just dont like the food here.  We always order big and have lots of different plates, all the plates were bland. Chow mein wasn't good, the soup was bland, the lemon chicken had no salt, the beef and broc was too mushy.  Maybe it was a bad day for the chef but enough for me.
author: lori c.

description: MMMM good.   A friend and I walked into Emmy's Spaghetti Shack to find they were closed.  Lucky us, the chef was having a bite to eat before opening, so I asked him for a recommendation for a good grub spot close by.  He directed us to the Jasmine Tea House, proclaiming it to be "the best chinese food in the city."  Well, I'm not sure about that, but it sure was tasty.  Fresh vegies and tasty sauces...even the dim sum sampler was a great appetizer.  The best part was that it didn't feel too heavy like some chinese food can.  My only complaint was the huge belch one of the staff let out as he walked through the dining room.  Hmmmm.....part of the authenticity?
author: Ryan W.

description: Great for delivery.  I live nearby and they usually take about 30 min to deliver, or are always on time if I walk over to pick it up.  Spicy pork is good and I love the chicken chow fun.  Try ordering a "combination" when you order for the first time.  If you are hungry, get the "I dont want to cook today."  It comes with two entrees, white rice, soup and two rolls for like nine bucks.  Not a bad deal and the delivery is free.  Damn, I'm getting hungry.
author: Mr. G.

description:
I have to join the chorus celebrating the mock chicken. It really does taste wonderfully (disturbingly, almost) like chicken breast. Really tender, sauce-flavored chicken breast.

Also I find that their vegetables are cooked to exactly the right degree. I think they even make adjustments for delivery food so that the veggies arrive cooked just right, rather than way overdone, as I am used to with veggie delivery.
author: Minger S.

description: I love this place. I eat here so often that they ask if I want 'the usual". I just love that! Great pot-stickers and the Ginger fish is very yummy!
author: Barbara W.

description: Okay so I know that the food has MSG, the meatless chicken is probably flavored with real chicken and all the vegetables and rice used are sprayed with toxic chemicals and genetically modified.  But why can't I stop ordering from them?  What are they putting in their Meatless Orange Chicken (an off menu fav or mine) that keeps me coming back?  I always order delivery and have rarely ate at the actual restaurant.  Maybe I'm in denial.  I know there are rats, cockroaches, poisonous chemicals, and who knows what else at the place but It doesn't stop me from breaking down and ordering sometimes.  I'm trying to quit but it's always haunting me to order their artery clogging fried processed dishes.  HELP!?!?!?!
author: Davidian A.

description: Nothing special, but it does the trick when you want Chinese food delivered in Bernal.  The broccoli beef is a solid standby choice if you're not vegetarian.
author: Linda G.

description: My husband and I had dinner delivered from here tonight at the recommendation of my sister-in-law. Great food. All of the food was brought to our house hot and all of the dishes tasted wonderful. We definitely will be ordering from them again.
author: Martha M.

description:
My review is of the Dim Sum and only the Dim Sum.
The Dim Sum was very very gelatinous. I've definitely had better. 

We got the following: 
Shrimp Dumpling - B
Shanghai Baby Bun - A
BBQ Pork Puff - F (the dough was very sour)
Stuffed Crab Claw - D (the crab tasted fishy)
Sesame Ball - C (gelatinous!)

I'll still check out this place for other dishes, but the dim sum was a lost cause.
author: A K.

description: Heard that this place has closed--for you meatless chicken lovers out there, try Big Lantern. Theirs is even better, in my opinion.
author: Tea B.

description: While I can't prove it, I'm fairly certain that this food made me ill last week. I had ordered delivery with my girlfriend and both of us had subsequent "G.I. issues". Even despite that, the food was only mediocre. If you check out the San Francisco Department of Public Health website, you will find that this place has consistently received very poor hygiene scores over the last several years - everything from rodents to poorly cleaned surfaces. I'm not sure if this is considered "normal" for such restaurants in the city. You be the judge.
author: Carter F.

description: Great and fast service! Yummy vegetarian options and great Mu Shu.
author: Emily C.

description: OK...I've been hear many many times.  Potstickers are VERY good (both the veggie and the pork ones).  Other dim sum is pretty good aside from the onion pancake.  Food is VERY oily and favorite dish is probably the claypot or the chicken lettuce cups.  Their noodle soups are acceptable and again the broth is a little oily and salty.  Good place to have in your neighborhood but NOT good place to judge Chinese food.
author: Aeon G.

description: Ordered takeout from here.  It was OK I guess but nothing special.  The meatless chicken was spongy with soft, almost mushy breading and the mushrooms in the chow mien were shriveled and old-looking.
author: P-nut K.

description: Good shit.  Quick delivery.
author: Katie H.

description:
I'm giving JTH 5 starts just for the Happy Buddha!  This dish was so delicious, my carnivorous friend loved it as much as I did.  The dish was packed with an array vegetables that were vibrant in texture and color.  The sauce was delectable and the faux chicken fantastic.  I loved this dish so much, I placed an order of it to go and enjoyed it the next day for lunch.  Additionally, I live in the East Bay and would absolutely come to The Mission to enjoy this dish again and try other dishes.

The Jasmine Prawns were not spicy and a bit of a disappointment.  Nonetheless, Happy Buddha shone so brightly, I stand by the 5 star review.
author: Carly B.

description:
dim sum @ any time of the day!  that alone gets 5 stars!

they can customize any of their dish to be vegetarian, and they are more than happy to replace any meat with the mock chicken (i almost think it's the real deal).

i love their hot and sour soup.  although for some reason it taste better when consumed on the premises as opposed to when delivered.

i had a craving for curry, and asked if they could substitute their curry chicken dish for mock chicken, and they were more than happy to do so.  they even added extra veggies on top of the standard ones to my curry dish.  let me tell you it was one of the best veg curries i have tasted!

3 cheers for JTH!
author: Sheri N.

description: As good as anywhere in Chinatown, fresh ingredients.  Big thick noodles and incredible mango chicken.  Cheap too!  They have a choice of special teas also, not the tea bag you usually get.  The duck is my favorite.
author: Gregory L.

description: First off, I grew up in Chinatown and I grew up eating the scary stuff.  I now live in Bernal with a wife (born in SoCal) and kid who aren't quite up the eating "the scary stuff" much less Chinese food.  One night I was wife/kid free and had a craving for white rice and "scary stuff" and  the menu was limited to very safe "American Chinese" food.  I asked the waiter if they had bitter melon and he looked at me funny and pointed to the folks in the chairs, I realized that I was the only Chinese guy other than the staff.  So I had Chinese broccoli with beef - in a pinch this is a good call, for the scary stuff - I am going to hoof it over to the Wing Hing on San Bruno Ave - my favorite hole in the wall.
author: Timothy W.

description: I have been loyal customer of Jasmine Tea House for well over eight years now. Three things stand out: 1. The excellent food, freshness of the ingredients, etc. 2. The friendliness of the staff and waiters, they owners have always taken a few moments out and chatted with us, etc. and 3. The consistency of both the food and service. I never hesitate taking business associates, clients or fiends here. They are always impressed.
author: Andrew M.

description: Great selection and overall good food that's not too sauce-heavy. They also serve brown rice. Plus it's right down the street.
author: Shinn Z.

description: I can count from 1 to 10 about good dishes from them. They are not super pretty but they are super delicious. 1. Wonton Soup; 2. Crab Puff; 3. Ostrich; 4. Shanghai fish fillet; 5. Seafood clay pot; ... And, more important is it's making your money smarter!
author: Yina M.

description: Unlike the other comments here, I thought the service was pretty good, fast. Decent, unremarkable food. My dining companion called it "standard flavor", which seems like the best way to describe it. I had the Kung Pao Meatless Chicken (good, although the "chicken" turns out to have been deep fried, heavier than I expected) and vegetarian potstickers, which were nicely, non-greasily fried. My dining companion had the Mandarin Claypot, with chicken and seafood in it.
author: Amy E.

description: The Jasmine Tea house is about a five minute walk from my place. So it may surprise you that I once ordered take out and it arrived eight minutes later. Seriously. Called at 7:52, and I had General Tsaos chicken before family guy could finish their theme song. The portions are huge, dishes are cheap, you get free rice if you order two or more dishes, and the food is less greasy than typical chinese.
author: John M.

description: I thought that I would have the hardest time living without meat. This place makes it easy!! I'm obsessed with the mu shu veggie, but that sesame chicken is so tempting... It's a nice clean restaruant, with good lighting and good service. But it's all about the food of course, and it gets all of the stars!
author: Ryan R.

description:
YUM-this place is delish and you can't beat their lunch special.

I took one star away because if you pay w/credit card, it's likely you will get someone else's card back if you get one at all.
author: nic d.

description:
its my new fav go-to local chinese joint. i havent been there enough to try everything, but so far my absolute favs are the schezhuan beef and any dish with black mushrooms- boy are they plump and juicy. :P

the service is good, delivery is on-time, and portions are generous. 

"okaaaaaaaaay".
author: Miss Lili F.

description: I love this place, they have really affordable lunch specials that come with a ton of food! they have the BEST meatless chicken!!! you can substitute any thing with it! oh and the dumplings and pork buns are off the hook!
author: Victor G.

description: Great service. Fast and friendly. The wanton beef soup maybe the best I have ever had. The ribs were just right. I over ordered on the food but left overs were amazing.
author: Julio S.

description: I absolutely adore Jasmine!  I borrowed a book from a friend and their business card fell out, that was what made me go for lunch.  Ever since that first lunch I order from them at least once a week. They are so good even my work orders from there when good Chinese food is needed!  Their sunflower chicken is awesome and the hunan salmon too!  Just thinking of their wonton soup makes my mouth water!
author: Erica N.

description: We randomly stumbled in here one night after getting tired of the wait at Emmy's Spaghetti Shack. We ordered the standard won-ton soup and it was amazing an topped with fresh veggies. The Prawns with Walnuts were also really really good and the sizzling beef was an all out culninary experience. This little place is a very well kept secret.
author: Angie S.

description: My girlfriend and I are always on the hunt for good Mongolian beef so we decided to try this place and let me tell you I think we found the best in the bay.....really! Now im a grump and its hard to please me (unless we go to my favorite fish store Ocean aquarium) I mean when you order this dish it should have a mild hint of heat with a well balanced amount of onions and beef (beef must be tender not dry or chewy) and a bed of rice noodles! Being that it was so good I think my girl was seriously hording it all for her self the next day and wouldn't let me take it to work for lunch (im not joking) she pack me a lunch with General Tsao's chicken which was kind of dry ,but any who I really recommend this place!
author: Matt B.

description:
crispy beef =new favorite. 

hot and sour is watery now :(

bummed
author: Lauren V.

description:
I've been getting take out from here since I moved into the 'hood like 3 years ago - I've never been disappointed.  I mostly get delivery, but, I've also eaten in a few times.  Admittedly, the dim sum items could use a little bit of work - but, they get some credit back for offering them anytime of day.  I love their seafood, vegetarian, and "chef's special" dishes.  Their mu shu and chow mein are some of the best I've had - they are my favorites.  And their hot and sour soup also passes my test - a bit more sour than hot, so I sometimes add a wee bit of hot sauce.  However, sometimes I ask them to make it hot and they always happily oblige.  Also, they are ridiculously nice and lovely people, both when I'm ordering delivery and visiting.  Admittedly, I wouldn't trek across the city to go here because there are many other great Chinese places in other parts of the City (San Tung was my favorite when I lived over in the Inner Sunset), BUT, if you're in the hood, this is really good.

However, please don't try and compare this place to Eric's or Alice's - those two places put a California twist on their dishes that Jasmine doesn't even try (and sometimes that California twist FAILS MISERABLY, in my opinion).  But, for straight ahead Chinese food, I've never gone wrong here.
author: Chris P.

description: The delivery service is super fast and the prices are very reasonable.  I got the chicken corn soup which I was craving and it was gooood!  The rest of the food was okay nothing spectacular.  Good fast chinese food delivery.
author: Rosh C.

description:
i love this place!
they deliver hot soup to our house and  the quality is amazing.
highly recommended!
author: olive l.

description: Delish! And very cheap. Get two entrees and get a free chow mein. This is the only place I order from when I want Chinese. Great for veggies...the fake meat is perfect.
author: Suzanne R.

description: Finally got a chance to see what all the fuss was all about. The decor almost scared me at first, as hot pink is all around the restaurant. The food: probably the worst hot and sour I have ever had....comes with the meal. The fake chicken Kung Pao......was very tasty. I would have preferred a little more of the entree opposed to the mountain of white rice that came with the dish, but what are you to do. I recommend ordering a regular entree and rice on the side. I am giving Jasmine three stars based on the owner's will to satisfy his customers. I was told to tell them what I want next time and they can make any possible vegetarian combination imaginable. Yeah!!!
author: Kenny G.

description: i love this place for vegan delivery. The fake chicken kicks ass, and they will sub it into any regular chicken dish, so there is lots to choose from .Sweet and sour veggie chicken and general tso veggie chicken are my faves, the pea sprout dish,tofu soup, veggie spring rools, and bhuddha hotpot are all tasty as well.
author: christie m.

description: Just got delivery from here. (It's still sitting limply on the coffee table.)  I had heard it was good from two different  people and also read good reviews on Yelp.  Boo!  Veggies were overdone (school cafeteria-style) and oily.  The "5 flavor" chicken was soggy.  The fried rice was nearly tasteless, except for the cardboard box essence.  The hot and sour soup was smoky and cloying.  The spring rolls were grease logs and luke warm.  Arrrrgggggh!  It was very cheap -- but whatever.
author: S S.

description:
*Edit* I must revise my take on the green beans.  They were bland at first, but it turns out all the sauce was at the bottom of the carton.  After a few days the beans at the bottom were soggy but delicious!  Upgrade to 4 stars.

---------------

Some hits, some misses here.  I ordered delivery because I was sick as a dog and couldn't cook or go out to eat.  I was craving chinese food for some strange reason, especially since I grew up eating mostly chinese food and don't go for it much these days.  Call it delerium.

In any case, I ordered a mix of four items, planning on living off the leftovers for a few days while I recuperate.  I had the mu shu chicken, general tso's chicken, dried sauteed green beans, and fish balls and seaweed soup.  Since I ordered two or more entrees I got my choice of free fried rice or chow mein.  I went with the chicken chow mein.

The misses first.  The chow mein was bland and tasteless.  I had to add pepper and chili sauce to eke any modicum of flavor out of it.  The green beans were the same.  Now I'm no super chili eater, but the green beans are listed on the menu as spicy, and I didn't get even a tingle.  It had less kick than a jar of Tostito's medium salsa.

Now the hits.  The general tso's chicken was very flavorful and still crunchy under all that sweet and vinegary sauce.  It could've been spicier however.  The soup was delicious.  Good flavor of seaweed mixed in with fresh fish balls.  My only complaint is too much egg flower and corn starch.  The mu shu chicken had good flavor as well, though the filling was very watery and soggy, causing most of my wraps to burst open as I was trying to eat them.

All in all an ok experience for the price.  Price with tax was less than $8 per dish, plus free chow mein.  I will try them once more for their vegetarian dishes, as I love chinese vegetarian food.
author: Chris C.
david f.

description: Jasmine Tea House is every bit as good as the other reviewers have declared.  My vegetarian friend is crazy about the meatless chicken, too.  I like the fresh vegetables and I feel as if nothing is ever greasy as in so many other Chinese food venues.  Good value - try it.  And Bill Clinton liked it too!
author: LaVonne J.

description: they still have the best fake chicken in town AND now that we've moved, they deliver to our house!!!   also, we went in for some dim sum and the server was super helpful pointing out the best vegetarian choices.  although then we just decided to try ALL the vegetarian choices.  and they were all wonderful.  and cheap!  and available all day!
author: kate s.

description: chinese is a tricky food to trust, but this place is sooo good!!! Awesome dimsum, chowmein, good lunch specials, and the best wonton soup you will ever try. Love it!
author: Jacqueline B.

description: This is, by far, the best delivery Chinese I've found in the city. Free fried rice or chow mein with every entree, too. So good. (I love the five flavors chicken, but the meatless stuff is just as supremely edible.)
author: Erin B.

description: I like this place because it's fast and delivers to the Mission and it's consistent. No it's not the best Chinese food I've ever had, but I generally don't expect that with a 40-minute delivery. I particularly like the crab puffs, General Tsao's chicken, Budda's Veggie Delight, and the fact that you get free Chow Mein or Fried Rice if you order two entrees. Yeah, it's a little greasy, but it's kinda good greasy, if you know what I mean.
author: Emmabelle S.

description:
The meatless chicken tastes meaty and the meaty chicken tastes like tofu! I swear it! They must be switching the two up every single time on accident, or do it on person so everyone'll rave about their meatless chicken. 

Seriously the tofu is like crunch crunch flavor explosion and the real one is soft and tender and weak like a little child. I would imagine.

Oh this place is Bill Clinton's favorite Chinese Restaurant in the city! You can tell because on the front door there are pictures they took of him while eating here and a forced confession or something. So until Obama starts hitting up that Chinese+Donuts place, I'm a proud patriotic to eat here I guess. 

But yeah, just know that it's one of the better chinese in the area. I'd give it 3.5 but I can't. Mongolian beef was my favorite there I think after getting over the whole fake chicken thing.
author: travis w.

description: Ok so this place rules, I get food their all the time, reasonably cheap, great portions and tons of vegetarian and vegan options. I love the General Tsao meatless chicken, as well a the kung pow tofu, the fried green beans, the hot and sour soup, the Happy Budda, and the Vegetarian appetizers. Plus I used to live on the block and going back there always makes me happy! but even if i don't go back they deliver!!!! HOLY CRAP!
author: Gabe L.

description: Great food, stunningly fast delivery, and SO cheap!!  The General Tsao's Chicken is awesome and so is the Moo Shoo Pork and the Peking Duck.  We've always been very happy and very full, and shocked by the lack of cost.
author: Fiid W.

description: Huh, I can't believe I haven't reviewed Jasmine yet.  It took a bit of menu exploration before I fell in love, but now we're inseparable.  Once every couple weeks, I turn to the Mister and say "I need that __________ (could be: sesame chicken, veggie potstickers, sesame beef, mu-shu pork, kung pao meatless chicken (both your vegetarian and carnivorous friends will flip for it)), and I need it now!"  I have no idea what we're going to do when we move away.  I don't even like to think about it.
author: sunny d.

description: This place is delicious.  Thank you Jasmine Tea House for delivering me food when I am lazy.  :-)
author: Ursinha G.

description:
The shrimp dumpings and combination won ton soup.  Perfect amount of food!  I ate this about four days in a row (i get obsessive about things sometimes . . . )

Delivery takes forever though, so if you can, just go pick it up.
author: blythewood m.

description:
Want to be hooked on crack but not lose all your friends? Their Sesame Beef is the solution.  Wonderful soups. The large selection of food is consistently good and the atmosphere is nice for both lunch and dinner. They also serve a small selection of dim-sum (though I wouldn't go just for that).  

1 star deducted because their take-out  takes forever and arrives soggy and not so delicious.
author: F N.

description:
I'm giving this one star only because it was edible and I was sharing a meal with a favorite friend. While chatting with someone at my local produce market, discussing veggie meats, he raved about this place. I came home and read the yelp reviews....looking good! 
I was disappointed for a variety of reasons. One is that the food is simply okay. Nothing to cause orgasmic sounds while eating. Not even close. Corn starch in everything. I had the veggie chicken kung pao. I've had way better with fake meat elsewhere. My friend had the shrimp, chicken, eggplant whatever. One star for the brown rice. Remove that star for failing to offer or bring chop sticks. I happen to love the sticks and was shocked that the assumption was, or at least appeared to be, that all white folks can't use them. I asked and our "i'd rather be anywhere but here" faced waiter brought two pair. Mine had old sauce on them. Sauce that was apparently so corn starched thickened that it turned into a paste. A brown paste. 
The artwork on the walls and the white tablecloth were both filthy. The claim to fame may be that Bill Clinton ordered food to go, but remember that he was also a huge Mc Donalds fan.
I will not be going back. If you want good fake meat, head over to Love 'n Haight. Their score card from the health dept. is nearly 100, far better (although I didn't see this one) than the Jasmine Tea House. At Love 'n Haight they are real and friendly! Open till the wee hours as well.
The service was the worst. The food average. The place less than clean.
You choose.
author: francez M.

description: seriously, you can't get beat the price. i've never ordered take-out, but my calss and i come here for celebration dinners, and everyone finds at least one dish that they go batty for. it's cozy, clean, and the sesame chicken is almost TOO good...
author: vanesa e.

description: I used to go to this place all the time when it was called Royal Kitchen and I never had a problem. Then I continued eating here after it became Jasmine Tea House and for a while I never had any problems and the food was very good...BUT, one day probably 1.5 yrs ago, I ordered a soup from here to be delivered at my job and after having  a few tablespoonsful, I found a COCKROACH in my soup!!!!!  I never went back. Well today while I was working, I heard someone getting grossed out in one of the departments and guess what happened?  She found a cockroach in her soup from this same place!!
author: Jess Y R.

description:
I can't get enough of this place. BEST MEATLESS CHICKEN EVER! It's not just the veg friendly food that's awesome either.

My best friend from NY was in town for a week and made us go back for a second time. It was the best sweet and sour chicken she's ever had. You'd never think this little place in the mission would be home to the best Chinese food ever.

My boyfriend a notorious carnivore can't stop himself from eating my  meatless sesame chicken.

Seriously this place rules. Great food, huge portions and price is super cheap.
author: G B.

description: very fast delivery , food is pretty decent  maybe i ordered the wrong things that day , general tsao chicken szechuan beef , both deepfried wish i knew that couldnt taste the quality of the meat at all. free chow mein with delivery i take that , they were actually good , dim sum were nice and warm but not much in , 3 stars for a quick delivery but i dont know about bill clinton
author: NAEL K.

description:
Since moving here, my boyfriend and I have been on a months-long quest to find excellent Chinese food in the city, and so far it's proven harder than we ever imagined. After reading all the reviews on Yelp, I was really excited to try out the Jasmine Tea House. As I picked up my takeout in the pleasant little restaurant tonight, I was even already imagining calling the boyfriend to tell him I'd found the place.

As it turns out, I hadn't.

Mind you, this place isn't bad at all. It's just not spectacular. The high point of my meal was the scallion pancakes, which were flaky and tasty and, overall, the best I've had around here. The potstickers were also completely unflawed, which, in a food that's so easy to screw up, is as much as I dare to hope for.

Now maybe I was so thrilled by the yummy appetizers that I didn't properly save myself for the main course, but even if that's the case, it just can't justify how lackluster the kung pao chicken was. While there was nothing truly bad about it, the sauce was thin and watery and, worst of all, there was next to no spice! Sad showing, kung pao.

My takeout dinner from here set me back more than eighteen dollars, and while it was enough for two people or two meals, that's still not cheap. I'll go back there again, for sure, because it's the best Chinese restaurant within walking distance of my house (people who live near here will vouch that that isn't saying too much), but I'm very sorry to say it wasn't the source of culinary delight I'd hope it would be.
author: Joanna L.

description:
Yay! We finally found a Chinese delivery place in the Mission that's good and doesn't leave me feeling sick and wanting to fumigate the apartment to get the smell out! Ordered it after reading Yelp reviews -- and trusting Bill and Hillary's judgment. 

We've only ordered delivery from here once, but so far, so good. The vegetable fried rice is excellent (and they include it for free with two entrees), as is the sesame chicken (and I usually don't like either of those.) It doesn't feel too greasy ... and the fried rice had lots of real, fresh vegetables. Obviously, it's Chinese delivery, so not the best food in the world, but when you're in the mood for that, this is a good place. Delivery was very fast. We'll be trying it again. Definitely beats Yum Yum, the previous delivery option, hands down.
author: claire c.

description: Best Chinese Takeout I've ever had. Delivery was prompt, even on a Friday night. The food was very tasty, well prepared and not loaded with oil and MSG. The prices are good too, especially considering there was enough of it for lunch tomorrow as well. Something interesting that I haven't seen in a Chinese restaurant before is that I couldn't find the typical "steamed rice" on the menu, but if you order two entrees you get your choice of fried rice (meat or veg) or brown rice or chow mien. We got the fried rice and it was more than enough to share. Enjoy!
author: Jamie D.

description: Great crispy egg rolls, and the Westlake Fish Fillet is great.  It's crispy and saucy and a little bit spicy.  Service is great, and it's a fantastic place for lunch or dinner.  I also really enjoy the Peking Duck and the Walnut Prawns.  Portions are huge for the price, especially at lunch time!
author: BuellRider ..

description: This is our go-to Chinese delivery spot of the moment.  (Only because so many new places open in the Mission every year!)  But really, the food is always good and arrives hot, hot, hot!  My husband's hot'n'sour soup was steaming when it arrived the other night.  My 14-year-old loves the combination dimsum plate-- the shrimp dumplings are quite good!  We also love the Basic Ostrich and fried tofu.  As a final compliment, we always eat Jasmine Tea House leftovers.  You know how some leftover chinese congeals in the refrig overnight?  Well, JTH's food seems to be better the next day!  And, they're one of the few that offers brown rice as well as white.
author: Kathryn S.

description:
i posess an invincible digestive system, except for pints of milk. i ate here, it was ok, until i got a horrible rash over my face and back. allergic reactions like that are a sign of gross negligence. the ostrich is probably dog.

Edit: after that first experience it was a while until i went back, frequenting wild pepper instead.  but wild pepper is a whole bunch of  blocks away, and the tea house is within sight of my doorstep, so i gave it another go. the lunch specials are quite cheap, and much less greasy than wild pepper. JTH also gives you the same free chow mein deal.  so i'm a semi regular now, just skip the dim sum and the "fancy" dishes and go for the spicy eggplant.
author: fletcher s.

description:
This place is ok as in it is your typical Asian restaurant, 80's style.

Our order was taken and the food arrived almost instantly which kind of freaked us out.

My husband loved it but I would need some convincing to go back.

I found the restaurant lacked any ambience or feeling. There were about 10 staff members who consistently watched 4 diners which irked me.
author: Ziggy P.

description: wow. no bueno. tried this place twice now...ordering different things, the "chef's specials" even. meh. to add to the disappointment, got the free chow mein when i ordered the free fried rice. :(
author: K K.

description:
I have had dinner at this bustling restaurant several times over the last several years, and I always meant to write a review. Every time I go there, I have consistently received a drop dead wonderful meal. I now even take visiting friends there when they come into town. There is even a rumor that Bill Clinton orders from here when he is in SF. I especially like the ostrich dishes (yes, ostrich), and their soups, but I think anything is safe to order. The prices are very reasonable, and the wine list, while not extensive, is well rounded and well priced also. And the staff are efficient, friendly and helpful. I even saw people ordering things not on the written menu, but I don't know how prevalent this is. 

So if you want to have one of the best Mandarin chinese meals of your life, get yourself to Jasmine Tea House. (I didn't see the Bill Clinton comment on the menu, but then I wasn't looking for it.)
author: Greg S.

description: jasmine tea house has the absolute best fake chicken in all of san francisco.  you have to ask for the sesame fake chicken.  trust me.  my carnivore friends like it even better than real chicken (and they are not just scared of me and saying that because they know i am crazy and will cut a ho!) and my dad couldn't tell the difference!  it really is the taj mahal of fake meats.  or something.  also, the singapore noodles here are delicious, the wait staff is awesome and they deliver to my home and always throw in extra free food!  plus, it's super cheap!  i love jasmine tea house!  oh yes and this is the place that bill clinton gets his delivery from when he is in town.  and you are not cooler than bill clinton.
author: Laura B.

description: i have no idea if this is good chinese food or not.  i grew up in florida- not known as a hotbed for fine chinese cuisine.  take out there consisted of sweet and sour breading and general tso generic brown sauce over something that may or may not have been chicken.  the food at jasmine is much better than that.  the meats are (a) present and (b) identifiable.  the service is friendly.  the delivery is fast.  the price is reasonable.  the dim sum is not as good as big lantern.  BUT the dry fried chicken wings and dry sauteed string beans are TO DIE FOR.  seriously.  i might be dead right now, just too high off their deliciousness to notice.
author: Samantha W.

description: Tasty vegan options and consistently friendly and efficient service!
author: D. B.

description: cops make me nervous and they seem to dine here quite frequently. that's pretty much the only thing i don't like about jasmine tea house. the food is delicious, the service is good, there's never a wait, they're good for groups, the lo mein is awesome, they will use less oil if you ask for it, the fake meat is fantastic. i am a fan.
author: Lily S.

description: I was looking for a good Chinese delivery place, so I turned to yelp for some guidance.  After some careful reading I decided on Jasmine Tea House.  What a mistake!  All of the food was extremely greasy, and lacked seasoning.  Between 4 people, we ordered 2 appetizers, 2 soups, and 4 entrees.  Everything (except the BBQ pork buns) tasted soggy, oily, and indistinguishable.  The food was so disappointing that we stopped eating it and threw it away.  $60 + dollars literally down the drain!
author: Kelly M.

description: DO NOT EAT HERE. I ordered from them a few weeks ago and the fried rice was frozen in the middle! Enough said.
author: Customer X.

description: The service is great and the Basil Chicken is awesome as well as the General's Tso's Chicken, the chow mein, the veggie potstickers and the hot and sour soup.  I've never done takeout so I couldn't tell you about that but in general it really doesn't matter which restaurant you order takeout from the food will never taste the same as when you order to eat in because by the time the food gets to you since its in a container the temperature from the hot food continues to cook the food so the taste of the food is compromised. SO.... this place is great. I don't understand some of the negative reviews but then again everyone has different taste.  But I have great taste so I give this place 4 stars. Check it out you won't be disappointed.
author: M R.

description: The shanghai fillet is great, as is everything else on the menu.  The quality does vary depending on what chef is working, hence some of the lower ratings.  I've had good luck going at night, generally on fridays or saturdays.
author: John D.

description: This place used to be 4**** in my book, but I've noticed it slipping lately. The veggies don't seem as fresh, meat seems lower quality, and the grease factor is rising!  My previous review of "Order the 'sizzling beef!' and plan to be pleased," seems (based upon tonight's meal)  to be outudated.
author: Michael H.

description: this may be my first one star review.  i'll have to go back and check.  i have been excited to try this place since everyone says how good it is and because of the clinton-factor.  tonight was the night.  we ordered delivery.  it got here.  we were starving.....and it sucked.  never before have i poured my hot and sour soup back into the container.   never before have i ate the white rice AROUND my kung pao instead of the actual kung pao.  never again, jasmine, it's back to eric's.
author: e w.

description: Yuk, I hoped that the previous negative comments about Jasmine Teahouse were anomalies, but nope...  The dim sum are bland and rubbery, and it's not just because I had it delivered.  There is a distinctive lack of flavor in most of the dishes.  The soy, chili sauce, and vinegar supplied with the dim sum overpower the flavor easily.  I am with the other posters about some sort of deep funk smell that pervades their dishes.  The hot and sour soup was not hot, it was brown, and bland, with sour so it was weird.  The peking duck was dry and not salty or crispy or lush like I am used to.  I really hoped for some yummy chinese food, and I think I learned a lesson about using Yelp, that's good.  I wish I had something good to report.
author: Privacy P.

description: We just got home from the Giant's game where we had the WORST pot stickers ever.  I said let's order some take out to get that taste out of our mouths.  I went to Yelp to see Chineese take out in the Mission/Bernal and for the second time in the same day....you got it .....the WORST pot stickers ever!!  What's up with that?? The rest of the food was a solid 3 on a 10 scale. Meh indeed.
author: kathy S.

description: this place is awesome. i'm not a vegetarian ... i like to eat animals ... but holy shite, i order everything with the meatless chicken. my personal favorite is the general tsao's (meatless) chicken. it's so good. also, try the sesame (meatless) chicken too. you can order any meat dish on the menu and substitute it with their meatless chicken. i used to always order from them when i lived in the mission ... i've been to their restaurant a few times. the food is a little better at the restaurant ... it tastes a little more fresh and the meatless chicken is a little more fresher and crispier (obviously). i would have given this place 5 stars, if it weren't for the fact that they don't deliver to my new neighborhood (tendernob)!! i need to go back soon.
author: James J.

description: i have finally found delicious chinese food and waiters with nice smiles!  though i can't comment on the meat, i was enamored with my "happy buddha", a pot full of willow fungus, mushrooms, bbq tofu, tofu skin, broccoli, baby corn, etc.
author: Kris P.

description: i found yelp the other day searching for reviews of chinese places, and decided on jasmine.  i'm so glad that i did, because:  the vegetarian eggrolls were amazing, the entrees were amazing, and did you know they have a coupon online somewhere for free chow mein if you get two or more other entrees?  just perhaps, if you were planning on ordering the seafood chow mein, and ask if their free chow mein can have seafood added to it, they will say yes (maybe) and it will maybe taste bland to you, but the person who ordered it will enjoy it a lot.  just perhaps.
author: Puck F.

description: One word: Ostrich. Yes, you heard right - ostrich. Basil Ostrich in fact. It tastes like tender, juicy but not as salty beef. But it's ostrich. Anyway, besides ostrich and frog legs, Jasmine Tea House has other standard fare. Though most dishes I've tried were on the bland side, nothing that your own spicing up won't remedy. Oh, and I say your own because I've never eaten at the actual restaurant. And why would I when they deliver AND if you order 2 entrees, they throw in a free chow mein or fried rice dish? Uh, yeah! So my decision to call in an order one night when it was pouring rain was well well worth it. Besides the delicious ostrich, I had an order of Happy Buddha - a cornucopia of veggies, fried tofu and mock chicken. The mock chicken was so good, I got confused for a second and thought I had ordered 2 meat dishes. The other notable in my order? Wor Won Ton soup! I don't know if the cold pouring rain made the delectable concoction of wonton, slices of pork and fresh veggies all the more enjoyable but it was the perfect prescription for the wet weather blues.
author: ray e.

description: Takeout to Noe Valley - took about 45 mins on a Sat night.   Had General Tsao's chicken (tasty), Chinese broccoli with oyster sauce (also tasty), and pork fried rice (pretty standard). Best Chinese takeout we've had in quite a while.
author: Dan R.

description: the food is pretty great here, the fake meat and pot stickers were SO GOOD.  then my boyfriend saw 4 cockroaches in the bathroom.  ugh.
author: Kate W.

description: The real name of this restaurant is The Jasmine Tea house but some friends and I prefer to call it Clinton's Chinese because of the multiple plaques and newspaper articles in the entrance proclaiming it was Bill Clinton's favorite Chinese restaurant in SF.  Haha --- that is some funny shi-at...  But, anyway, almost every dish is great here.  They even have Ostrich.  The pot stickers are a great appetizer and even the fried rice and chow mein noodles are top notch.
author: David M.

description: Super yummy chinese food, never too greasy.  I particularly love their Happy Buddha!  But I've noticed the food quality has gone slghtly downhill the last year or so; before, I would have given it five stars without hesitation.
author: Amy W.

description: Kung pao meatless chicken, veggie dim sum. Some times the kung pao comes out and the meatless chicken chunks are not hot all the way through.  Other than that this place is the best, just come here before the dinner rush or there might be a long delay between the time you get served and you dinning partner gets served. I've seen three waiters taking delivery orders on three different phones at the same time.
author: Sarah J.

description: Every Sunday, my fiancee gets a craving for Chinese food. I don't understand it, but it has caused me to eat at a lot more random Chinese places than I care to admit. A few weeks ago it brought us to Jasmine Tea house for lunch. I think this place has turned me into a Chinese food addict. First of all, their lunch specials are $5.25 for a huge huge portion of food, soup and rice. For someone who loves going out to eat, but has become sick of spending hundreds of dollars on a good meal, this made me immediately happy. I try to be pretty health conscious so I always feel guilty eating Chinese food but all the veggies in the dishes are steamed, the chicken is whole pieces of white meat and depending on the dish, some of it isn't even breaded. I very rarely suggest that we go out for Chinese, but I suggested we go back a few days ago and my hungover food craving from NYE is probably going to bring us back today. I would give it 5 stars, and for the price maybe I should. Perhaps toady's visit will earn the place a perfect score=)
author: Lindsay B.

description:
definitely soom good stuff. im writing one handed right now, because im not done eating.


nothing like watching dead man and eating chinese food on a cold night.
author: easton g.

description: We ordered take out from this place. Unfortunately, the Cashew Chicken had no cashews and the Mu Shu came without plum sauce, one of the key ingredients. Spring rolls were on the greasy side. Other than that the food was okay.
author: Christel V.

description: This is one of the most delicious veggie Chinese food restaurants in the city. The Korean (veggie) chicken is fantastic! The staff is also very friendly and accommodating.
author: Lynn R.

description: Really good food, super friendly staff, unbelievably fast delivery, average price.  I love it!
author: Jo M.

description: all i'm going to say is sweet and sour meatless chicken.
author: Happy M.

description: i would definately eat there again. i loved the meatless chicken entrees.  good non-greasy, pretty fresh and fast, friendly delivery.
author: shawna s.
